dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A castle of shadow. (OVER) RAIN, HOWLING evil wind. Sudden lightning CRACKS, illuminates the aged structure, the hanging metal sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. BURTON, the Chief Psychiatrist moves down the old hallway, face tense. He steps through a doorway into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Security cells. Criminal maniacs sealed behind protective casings. A GUARD stands before a heavy door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell of a night, huh Doc?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell's in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hydraulics HISS. The cell door unseals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Small. Walls, ceiling, floor, padded.  A single window casts the room in pallid moonlight. A figure sits in shadow, bound by the wraps and ties of a straight jacket, gaze fixed out the window. Lightning flashes, brightening the room. THUNDER CRACKS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Dent...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No answer. Burton steps closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Counselor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still nothing. Another step.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burton reaches towards the figure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey are you alright...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burton touches his shoulder. Lightning flashes as... THE BODY WHIPS around. An orderly, gagged, sits bound to the chair with bedsheets. The sheets around the chair have been rigged. Now they yank him up so he spins frantically from the ceiling fan. Lightning flashes again, illuminating a madman's scrawled writing on the wall. WRITING - CLOSE. "The Bat Must Die!" THUNDER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gothic towers of granite and glass shimmer golden in the late day sun. 6      MOVE IN towards the city as an executive helicopte CROSSES FRAME. Through the window BRUCE WAYNE, still handsome but a few lines starting to show, sits watching a seatback video screen. 7      CONTINUE In over Gotham Harbor towards the skyline (OVER) A NEWSCASTER talks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...And in Gotham City, ex-District Attorney Harvey Dent escaped from Arkham Asylum for the Criminally Insane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 8      CLOSER on a single building, its power generated b small but mighty dam below. A glowing sign reads Wayne Enterprises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dent, once Gotham's leading contender for Mayor, was horribly scarred during an indictment hearing over a year ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HOLD on a single window. MOVE IN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elegant. Oak. A wall monitor runs the same newscast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dent questions a crime boss on the stand. A thug throws a vial of acid toward Harvey, searing half his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dent, whose left-brain was damaged during the assault, launched a grizzly crime spree before being captured by The Batman. He is extremely dangerous. Repeat....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce Wayne ENTERS, his Armani suit the only thing fresh about him, followed by a sudden stream of EXECUTIVES, SECRETARIES, ASSISTANTS and GOTHAM SOCIETY MATRONS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The solar generator tests are back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh... great, could you wait a second...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mayor's office called again -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you asking to the circus -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five minutes to your inspection -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody freezes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I want you all to just stand here for fifteen seconds, okay? Fifteen, everybody got it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Folks nod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Nobody move, now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And with that, Bruce turns and walks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) I gotta give myself a raise...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Endless work-spaces stretching into infinity. Bruce, a Junior Exec ENTOURAGE trailing, tours an assembly line where robotic arms weld laser tools. FRED STICKLEY, a fuss-budget plant manager, leads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your weekly inspections are a departmental highlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? (a warm smile) You all need to get out more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 13      CRANE UP high over the factory floor, across acre assembly lines and work stations. ANGLE DOWN on

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A clutter of computer parts. Paperwork everywhere. Rubik's cubes, games, dozens of puzzle books all boasting the green suited caricature of "The Guesser". 15      MONITOR-CLOSE. A crossword puzzle. Features reflect over the acrostic. The two images resolve into one; the face itself is a puzzle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EDWARD NYGMA, awkward, brilliant and feverishly anxious stares up at the screen, TALKING to himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll probably go to the house for dinner. Yes. Yes. Maybe he'll throw a little party in my honor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly Edward BANGS his head against the desk-top. Hard. A brief window on the inner Edward, all insecurity and self loathing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Idiot! Should have rented a tuxedo. (suddenly calm) Relax. I'm sure Wayne manor has extra. After all, we're almost the same size.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 17      The opposing wall is a shrine to Bruce Wayne:  ne headlines, a GQ cover, magazine photos. 18      Approaching COMMOTION.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God. It's him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Workers greet the boss. Bruce is friendly, welcoming, Edward appears on the edge of the group. Stickley spots Edward. A cloud crosses his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Mr. Wayne, on to R&D?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stickley rests his hand on Wayne's elbow. Begins to steer him away. Not in time. Edward steps forward. A man so uncomfortable, his very skin seems to be a costume. He marches right up to Wayne, takes his hand, fawning, the burning eyes of a sycophant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce Wayne. In the flesh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (easy going) Um...I'm pretty sure I'm Bruce Wayne. And you are?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nygma. Edward Nygma. You hired me. Personally. Just like I tell everyone. (sotto voce) Well, we've never actually met, but your name was on the hire slip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He still hasn't let go of Bruce's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna need that hand back, Ed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Ah yes. Of course. I'm sorry. It's just that...you're my idol. (off Stickley) And some people have been trying to keep us apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Nygma, you'll forgive me for being rude. But what exactly is on your mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precisely. What's on all our minds? Brainwaves. The future of Wayne Enterprises is Brainwaves!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's hard to imagine anyone more awkward. The effect is painful. Folks stare, mouths wide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto voce) I really do apologize, Mr. Wayne. His project was terminated this morning...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignoring Stickley) Let me ask you something, Bruce. What is man's greatest tool?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few of the WOMEN SNICKER. For a second, Edward's face twitches, a crack in the facade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man's greatest tool is...The mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 20      Edward gestures to his cubicle. A rat's nest clut with components of his Rube Goldberg-like invention.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Voila. While holographically enhancing any TV picture, my invention connects directly to the viewer's brain, puts the audience inside the show. Think of the entertainment problems we can solve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can think of a couple problems that need solving right here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few more folks CHUCKLE. Edward looks around. Another ripple of anxiety, another quick recovery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why be brutalized by an uncaring world? My RES Box will give Joe Q Public a realm where he is king. (sultry) Not that someone like you would need it. Someone so intelligent. Witty. Charming. But for the lonely, the...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paranoid? The psychotic?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (didn't miss it) ...The Box can change their lives. (looking around) Our stock coupons will spike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward turns, actually CLAPS Stickley on the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell. Might even bring old Stickley here a few extra bucks. Huh, Fred?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce takes off his glasses, rubs his eyes in vague disbelief, cleans the lenses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wayne Enterprises will spearhead an entertainment revolution.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward removes his glasses, cleans them in exactly the same manner as Bruce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just need a bit of additional funding. For human trials. Let me show you....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce seems about to speak when suddenly -

dialogues.speaker: THE BATSIGNAL
dialogues.text: beams bright against the night clouds over Gotham City.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: (time to move) Maybe some other time..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to know, we'll be full partners in this, Bruce. (waxing rhapsodic) What talks we'll have, late into the night. Now, I'm not used to business travel, so go easy on me. As for recognition, I'm sure after a time I'll get used to it. (a beat) Look at us. Two of a kind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward is suddenly aware of dozens of co-workers all around him, SNICKERING and WHISPERING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce's eyes dart again toward the Batsignal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call my secretary, she'll set something up. (turning) Factory looks great, folks.  Keep up the good work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (desperate) Wait. You can't go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll talk some other -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sudden rage) No. Don't leave me! My invention! I need you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward has grabbed Bruce's arm. The room goes dead quiet. Bruce's eyes narrow. Then he dislodges gently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Edward. Just feels a bit like mind manipulation. It raises too many question marks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce heads off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright everyone, back to work. (to Edward) We'll discuss this later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward stares after Bruce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were supposed to understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HOLD on this tiny man, all alone in the labyrinthine work-place, eyes darkening now with growing obsession.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll make you understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 24      INT.  BRUCE WAYNE's PRIVATE OFFICE Bruce ENTERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 25      THE DOOR - CLOSE. LOCKS. Bruce falls into a leath

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Capsule.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 26      Suddenly the chair seat drops, fast, sliding into transport capsule.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The capsule shoots through the underground tunnel, lights WHIPPING past at near super-sonic speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speed and time readouts appear on the windscreen beside the craggy face of ALFRED PENNYWORTH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alfred...

dialogues.speaker: ALFRED
dialogues.text: I saw the signal, is. All is ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alfred watches the capsule arrive. 31      QUICK CUTS of glove, boot, and cape being donned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FOLLOW Batman's feet as he steps up to the Batmobile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suppose I couldn't convince you to take along a sandwich.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Batman jumps into the Batmobile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Alfred) I'll get drive-thru. (to the car) Go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 33      The car shoots a whitish-blue light from under it belly. Hub Caps and detailing glow as The Batmobile zooms out of the cave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car SHOOTS through a series of underground arches. The car picks up speed, the blue-white fusion drive going blue, then purple, then red. The single bat wing splits into two as the car becomes a stealth bullet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dark car WHIPS through a holograph of  trees that masks the entrance to the Batcave, SCREECHING onto...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car speeds towards Gotham.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Batsignal, cutting the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A worried THUG peers at the Batsignal out the skyscraper window. Across a narrow abyss stands a skyscraper under construction, all girders and scaffolding. 39      In f.g., a spinning silver dollar flips up into f blocking out the Batsignal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bat should show any minute, Face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HAND catches the coin, flips it again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Witness the rakishly handsome profile of HARVEY TWO-FACE DENT, the other side of his face hidden in shadow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You. Sport. Any thoughts? Counting on Batass to rescue you?

dialogues.speaker: PULL BACK TO REVEAL
dialogues.text: A SECURITY GUARD, laying on the floor, wrists and feet bound, trembling with fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: _We_ sure are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...You gonna kill me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Might. Might not. Could say we're of two minds on the subject.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got family. ...Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What say we flip for it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two-ace shoves the silver dollar under the Guard's nose. One side shines in mint condition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What could be fairer than the random toss of an honest coin? Life...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other side bears deep, disfiguring burns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...or death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. I swear I won't say noth-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The coin _wants_ to decide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 41      Two-Face flips. The coin spins, gleaming, lands o floor only inches from the Guard's face. 42      Two-Face STOMPS the coin. Winks at the sweating G

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exhilarating, isn't it?  The suspense? Sudden death or a new lease on life? Really makes a man live in the moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two-Face removes his foot. Unblemished side up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're in luck. You get to live to whimper another day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Guard SOBS with relief. Harvey's Thugs GRUMBLE. Two-Face folds his jacket into a pillow, places it under the Guard's head, now the nicest crook in the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That floor has got to be very hard. Is that better?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, yeah. Thanks, Mr..uh...Face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just call us Harvey. Can we get you a sandwich? A soft drink? Given all the trouble we caused you, how about we cut you in for a share of tonight's haul?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Face! For cryin' out loud! You're not gonna pay him--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two-Face turns on Thug 2 with a vengeance, shooting out a hand that pins the fellow's throat to the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did we ask your opinion? The coin has rendered its verdict. This man has a family to take care of. You have a problem with that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We now see for the first time the LEFT HALF OF HIS FACE: hideously repulsive, an acid eaten mutilation of flesh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no, Face. Anything you say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweeping spots. Swat teams. Police wagons. 44      COMMISIONER GORDON, 50s, a man who's seen enough for a lifetime, stands in his trademark trenchcoat, lighting a cigarette. Beside him stands a beautiful, professionally dressed young woman. DR. CHASE MERIDIAN.

dialogues.speaker: HIGH ABOVE
dialogues.text: The Batmobile SCREECHES to a stop on a pedestrian bridge. 46      THE BATSIGNAL is suddenly obscured, flows for a m into the shape of Batman's cape as the Dark Knight leaps 47      down past the spotlight, lands face to face with

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hot entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Batman turns, all business as he speaks to Gordon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two-Face?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two guards dead. He's holding the third hostage. Didn't see this one coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should have, though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men turn to face her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: _Two_ million dollars waiting to be transferred from the _Second_ Bank of Gotham on the _22nd_ How could Harvey? _Two_-Face resist?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you are?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Batman, I'd like you to meet--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (offering her hand) Chase Meridian

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I asked Dr. Meridian to come to Gotham to consult on this case. She specializes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...dual personalities. Abnormal psychology. Washington's poster child for the criminally insane. I read your work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm flattered. Not every girl makes a super-hero's night table.  You might have some interesting insights into Two-Face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's just say I could write a hell of a paper on a grown man who dresses like a flying rodent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bats aren't rodents, Dr. Meridian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know that. See? You _are_ interesting. And call me Chase. By the way, do you have a first name? Or do I just call you bats?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I remind you two we have a psychopathic murderer on the loose here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A titanic BOOM rocks the night. 48      SEARCHLIGHTS race up the skeletal skyscraper to R A giant CRANE and WRECKING BALL. The wrecking ball SMASHES again into the bank building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The already crumbling wall behind Two Face EXPLODES. Two- Face checks his watch, unfazed, as the giant wrecking ball CRASHES into the room within inches of the villain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right on schedule.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two-Face's men scramble to the hole, attach chains to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...an even thicker chain dangling 30 stories from the roof of the construction site. FOLLOW THE CHAIN UP as it yanks tight, revealing... A BLACKHAWK HELICOPTER already atop the construction site, perched on steel beams. REVVING its mighty rotors. 51      A giant winch aboard the Blackhawk starts to haul safe chain over pulleys up into a cargo hatch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thug 1 stares out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bat's taking the bait! What now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 53      Harvey flips the coin. 54      FOLLOW THE COIN as Two-Face snatches it from mid- slaps it on his wrist. Bad side up. 55      ANGLE ON - Two-Face's left side. Scarred, gloatin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At last, The Bat dies!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chains suddenly yank the safe towards the hole in the wall. Thug 2 gestures to the Guard on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kill him too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thug 2, grinning, draws a GUN from his waistband.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait! You said you'd let me go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never heard of a double-cross?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 56      A DING from the elevators. The Thugs and Harvey all whirl, machine guns coming up, open FIRE, armor piercing bullets punching holes in the metal doors, shredding anyone inside. THE GUARD lays bound on the floor. Suddenly a clamp-ended bat-cable drops from above. With a tiny CLICK, the smart- clamp hooks onto the Guard's wrist bindings.

dialogues.speaker: ELEVATORS
dialogues.text: HARVEY AND THUGS empty magazines. Re-load.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on in, the water's fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All stand watching as the now perforated elevator doors slide, jerking, open to reveal...an empty elevator. The skylight overhead EXPLODES and, in a rain of glass, Batman drops to the floor on a Batrope. 58      THE GUARD is apparently attached to the Batrope's end because, as the Caped Crusader comes down, the Guard shoots up, hoisted fast to the safe rooftop above.

dialogues.speaker: FIRE DOORS
dialogues.text: BLOW open. Two SWAT teams burst in, armed for bear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police!  Freeze!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not the guest list we had in mind. Boys, the party's over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two-Face drops a SMOKE GRENADE. Then he leaps directly out the hole in the wall. His Thugs take off after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Thugs come leaping through the hole, using the now rising safe as a springboard to close the windy gap, roll to safety on the construction site next door.  They scatter, begin scaling various beams and girders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swat Teams race through the smoke in close pursuit, come up short at the edge of the urban precipice. The safe has risen too high, now, to serve as a springboard, so the cops drop, begin FIRING across the gap. Suddenly... A DARK WING explodes out of the smoke behind them, flying across the abyss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Thug fires at the figure hurling towards him. Batman lands on the Thug's chest, smashing him to the floor. Suddenly, from above, BULLETS CRACK off the girders beside the Caped Crusader's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO-FACE glides upward, riding the wrecking ball as it overtakes the safe, shooting down at Batman. 64      BATMAN starts scaling the scaffolding after Two-F He's climbing fast but Harvey has too great a lead. 65      BATMAN - POV. A motorized gantry is carrying one Thugs up to the roof. 66      Batman FIRES a Batarang. The bat-shaped clamp bit the wooden base of the rising gantry. He toggles the launcher into winch mode, is hoisted fast towards the rising gantry above.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE GANTRY
dialogues.text: The riding Thug leans down, sees the rising shadow, grabs the Batrope in both hands and flips over the gantry.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE BATROPE
dialogues.text: The Thug slides fast down to kicking range, draws back his boot to dispatch Batman. Batman hits a switch on his launcher, increasing the winch speed, shooting him higher, faster. He grabs the Thug's foot in his hand, shoves him up so his head CRACKS against the bottom of the gantry. Batman swings the unconscious Thug onto a hanging construction hook, leaving him dangling in mid-air by his nose ring, hoists himself up onto...

dialogues.speaker: THE GANTRY
dialogues.text: From the scaffolding above, a Thug drops to one end of the gantry, nun-chucks spinning madly. Behind Batman, another Thug drops INTO FRAME, drawing a machine pistol. Batman reaches forward, grabs the Thug's spinning nun- chuck, stunning his face with the wooden sticks. In a single move, Batman spins and lets the weapon fly into the pistoled assailant, knocking him flat. 70      BATMAN - POV. Two-Face has reached the chopper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two-Face climbs into the chopper's cargo bay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the pilot) Let's fly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Batman sees the helicopter start to rise, pulling the safe overhead along with it. 73      Batman jumps, drops through the abyss between the buildings, landing on... 74      A HIGH TENSION WIRE - CLOSE. The wire bends like shooting Batman like an arrow straight into the air. 75      Batman grabs the rising chain, slides down it's l he is standing atop the safe. 76      He FIRES a Batarang into the bank wall, making an attaches the Bat-cable to the hitch atop the safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chopper is straining against Batman's bank-embedded tether. Two-Face looks down in fury.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man is taking his job _much too seriously_.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Batman palms a compartment on his utility belt and a small delivery mechanism SNAPS a tiny acetylene torch into his gloved hand. A BLUE FLAME ignites. Batman starts to cut the chains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Batman's torch slices the last link. Batman reaches up and grabs the winch chain, is jerked suddenly upward with the now un-tethered chopper as...

dialogues.speaker: THE SAFE
dialogues.text: now freed, swings like a pendulum on it's anchor line, arcing straight for the hole in the bank wall from which it was originally drawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The safe comes flying through the hole, sliding across th floor and SLAMMING back into place before the bewildered faces of the SWAT team.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two-Face stares out the side of the chopper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was our money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two-Face grabs the controls from the pilot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wants to play. Fine, let's play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 83      Two-Face pulls back on the throttle, the chopper straight up into the sky like a rocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Batman hangs from the chain, trailing the chopper, a wing of shadowy quicksilver disappearing into the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gotham's Times Square. Tall. Narrow. The crawl of bumper- to-bumper traffic. Glutted with neon signs and giant animated billboards. 86      The helicopter ROARS into view.  BATMAN hangs on life as the city rushes past. 87      A SERIES OF SHOTS as street folks look up in wond 88      SIGN - CLOSE. For Ginsu Knives. A couple of giant make fast work of a steak on a smoking barbecue. The chopper swings Batman _through_ the ad, falling blade just missing him, dragging him through the thick smoke. The chopper swings across the square, heading for... 89      ANOTHER SIGN - CLOSE. This time a tremendous set clacking teeth turn yellow to white each time the cap lifts off of a giant tube of toothpaste. 90      The chopper barrels straight for the opening mout At the last moment the chopper banks, whipping the dangling Batman inside the mouth. 91      The mouth closes on the Caped Crusader. 92      The chopper pulls away, the chain pulling like fl through the closed teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Batman, still clutching the chain, is flying towards the barricade of closed teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Batman SMASHES through the two front teeth. 95      BATMAN - CLOSE. His face suddenly bathed in an ev brightening yellow glow.

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH THE WINDSHIELD
dialogues.text: Dead ahead, another sign. This one is essentially a giant neon sun, the Wayne Tech logo burning bright yellows and reds over the message Solar: The Power of the Future. 97      Harvey GUNS the chopper's engines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Face!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chopper BLOWS straight through the nova, neon EXPLODING like stars in all directions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the Pilot, in the b.g. regains control of the chopper, Harvey walks to the hold, looks down through the hatch at the dangling chain below. No Batman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, to finally be rid of that pointy eared, steroid eating, rubber suited, cross dressing, night rat...

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH THE WINDSHIELD
dialogues.text: a familiar blue cape falls down over the plexi-glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh...boss....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey spins, draws his machine pistol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too late. Harvey SPRAYS wildly, blowing holes in the windshield and Pilot as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cape slips off the windscreen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chopper dives. Two-Face staggers towards the pilot's chair. He rests free the corpse, regains control. A FIST SMASHES through the side window into Harvey's jaw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey, you need help. Give it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Batman stands on one of the struts, begins trying to climb into the open side of the speeding bird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Words of wisdom from our ex-friend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey SLAMS Batman's face with his foot. He goes down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mano a Mano a Bato.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Batman pulls himself back up. Grabs Harvey's foot. Flips him to the floor. Drags him half way out of the bird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surrender.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ever been to Arkham, Batman? You'd feel right at home. You took a year of my life. So I'm here to pay you back. There's only one way out of this waltz. One of us dies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't kill you, Harvey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Batman gets Harvey by the throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Batman doesn't kill? Bullshit. (epiphinous) You're a killer too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somehow Harvey's words seem to shake Batman a beat. It's all the distraction Harvey needs.  He SMASHES Batman across the face. Batman slips, falls out of sight. 104      WINDSHIELD - CLOSE. Lady Gotham is coming up fas

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Batman hangs by one hand from the support strut, the bird hurling towards the giant statue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey locks "The Club" onto the controls, fixing the chopper on it's deadly course. 107      Batman hoists himself into the chopper through t side in time to see Harvey standing over the cargo hatch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye old pal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With that Harvey leaps through the cargo hatch. 108      Batman stares frozen in disbelief as Two-Face pl the dark water below. 109      Then a sudden flurry of expanding color caught i Gotham's lighthouse beam, and a parachute opens over Two- Face, unfolding into a giant Yin-Yang. 110      BATMAN - POV - The windshield SHATTERS into the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The helicopter EXPLODES into the left side of Lady Gotham's face. A tremendous fireball splits the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Batman is falling. Still. Eyes closed. Maybe dead.

dialogues.speaker: FLASHES OF
dialogues.text: 113      (OVER) A SCREAM. Two SHOTS. A pair of roses hit 114      A BOY runs through a storm, a book clutched in h 115      A FALL down a narrow stone chute, into a cave. 116      A BAT, huge, evil, SCREECHING.

dialogues.speaker: BATMAN FALLING
dialogues.text: Batman plummets towards the water. His eyes open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Batman SPLASHES into the harbor. Dark. Still. Then, a familiar cowl breaks the surface, GASPING for breath. Batman stares up at the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lady Gotham's one beautiful face now burns the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark, save the light from a single cubicle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward sits hunched over his desk, working on his invention. Sweat beads his brow, lips MUMBLING furiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (obsessive repetition) Too many questions. Too many questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward glances up at the picture of Bruce Wayne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll show you it works.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is going on here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stickley stands before Edward's cubicle. Not happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your project is terminated. I'm calling security.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stickley turns to go. Mistake. Edward CRACKS Stickley on the head with a coffee pot. Down he goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caffine'll kill you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stickley awakens to find himself strapped in a swivel chair. Edward is placing an elaborate computerized headband over Stickley's head. (OVER) a small TV hooked into Edward's contraption runs a fishing show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This won't hurt a bit. (musing) At least I don't think it will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward reaches for a small transceiver fused to the TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamnit, you press that button and-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 123      Too late. A green beam explodes from the TV scre engulfing Stickley. 124      IN THE BEAM - a small holographic representation fisherman reeling in a prize bass. 125      STICKLEY - POV - As far as Fred is concerned he' shore, the fisherman's catch flapping in his face. 126      The TV signals begin to waver and tremble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loosing resolution. More power.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He increases the power toggle. BACKFIRE. A sudden white light shoots back into the TV and up, surrounding Ed. STICKLEY - CLOSE. His eyes dull, glaze over. EDWARD - CLOSE. The effect on him seems to be quite the opposite. Invigorating, sexual. THE BEAM-FLARES. A tiny nova. Overload. Both men SCREAM. All light vanishes. EDWARD - CLOSE. His face buried in his hands. Edward peers up from his hands. Look into his eyes. One thing is sure. Edward Nygma has gone power mad, totally insane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (game show host) Fred Stickley. Come on down. You're the next contestant on I Want Your Brain. (Wayne-like) Nygma your machine has unexpected side effects. A feed back loop has caused your brain to absorb Stickley's neural energy. (hyper) Stickley, I've had a break- through! And a breakdown? Maybe. Nevertheless. I'm smarter. Hell, I'm a genius. More than a genius. Several geniuses. Genae. Genie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed rises, BABBLES a dazed Fred's lips with his finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (short order cook) Yo. Charlie. Gimmie an order of brain deep-fry. Extra well done. Hold the neurons. (a scientist) Patient exhibits symptoms of psycho neural overload. Notation: obviously higher settings can be dangerous to the subject. (pacing) Riddle me this, Fred. What is everything to someone and nothing to everyone else? Your mind of course. And now mine pumps with the power of yours. (urban) New from Brain-bok. Da pump. Think faster. Reason higher. Out-cog-nate every homey on the court of life. Da pump. Yeah. (Shakespearian) Ho! Mark. I sense an odd penchant for the anagramatic. The acrostic. The crypto-graphic. What doth this bode? Answer me Marcutio, you little runt. (gourmet) Fred, I must confess you were a wonderful appetizer. Simply divine. But now I yearn for a meal of substance. The main course. A wide and varied palette. Ah, to taste the mind of a hero. A nobleman. A poet. (Groucho) A chick in a short skirt wouldn't be so bad either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Fired...your fired...your fired. You understand?! Fired!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward savagely sends Stickley careening across the slick floor still strapped to the swivel chair. 127      Stickley heads straight for the huge round windo 128      Edward seems like he has regrets as he dashes af Stickley. The chair...

dialogues.speaker: SMASHES THROUGH THE ROUND WINDOW
dialogues.text: It teeters on the edge of the building, dam and RUSHING water below. Stickley is being held on the precipice by the long wire attached to his headband. It is really only this that Edward came to save.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Fred. Babe. _You_ are fired. Or should I say Terminated!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He yanks the invention from Stickley's head and he crashes below to certain death. Ed races back to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Question marks, Mr. Wayne?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stands staring at the picture of Bruce Wayne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My work raises too many question marks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a frenzy, Edward begins tearing up the magazines lying on his desk, ripping out individual words, pasting them quickly onto a blank piece of paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two years. 3.5762 percent of my estimated lifespan toiling for your greater glory and profit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He SMASHES the framed GQ cover of Bruce on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, let me ask you some questions, Mr. Smarter Than Thou. Why are you so debonair? Successful? Richer than God? Why should you have it all and not me? Yes, you're right, there are too many questions, Bruce Wayne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward STOMPS on the picture, pulverizing the glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like why hasn't anybody put you in your place? And it's time you came up with some answers. Starting right now!

dialogues.speaker: A SERIES OF IMAGES-
dialogues.text: 132      (OVER) A SCREAM. SHOTS. Roses fall to the paveme 133      A YOUNG BOY stands staring into a parlor where t coffins rest. Thomas and Martha Wayne. Dead leaves whip through the hallway. 134      SMALL HANDS touch a leather bound book. Suddenly pages are splattered with blood. Wind blows out two flickering candles. 135      THE BOY runs through a dark, stormy night, the b clutched in his hands. He slips. A sinkhole. 136      A FALL down a narrow chute. The boy lands in a d 137      A GIANT MONARCH BAT, fangs bared, SCREECHES towa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a killer too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In his bed, Bruce wakes, trying to blink away the images. Alfred draws the curtains, welcoming rich autumn sun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dreams again, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think they're getting worse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a wonder you sleep at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Bruce sits up, Alfred notices a fresh set of bruises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a marvelous shade of purple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce shoots him a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really, sir, if you insist on trying to get yourself killed each night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alfred picks up Bruce's carelessly-tossed Batsuit from the floor. Ripped, dented, punctured.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Would it be a terrible imposition to ask you to take better care of your equipment?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you'd have nothing to complain about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hardly a worry, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alfred brings a robe, holds it out for Bruce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commissioner Gordon phoned. There's been an accident at Wayne Enterprises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the window is replaced in b.g., Edward Nygma stands SOBBING before the head of personnel. With augmented brain power apparently comes augmented acting talent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (inconsolable) Why? Oh, why? I can't believe it. Two years. Working in the same office. Shoulder to shoulder, cheek to cheek, ---we're talking face, by the way---and then this. (handing her a note) I found this in my cubicle. You'll find the handwriting matches his exactly as does sentence structure and spelling. (suddenly sobbing again) I couldn't possibly continue on here. The memories. I'll just get my things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward slips out a side door, quickly avoiding Bruce and Gordon as they walk towards Bruce's office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've questioned everyone who worked on the floor. Computer records show no one going in or out after Stickley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Computer records can be forged. I'll have my people pull up --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cop hands Gordon the forged note.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suicide. With all due respect, leave the police work to us. We'll be in touch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the Commissioner exits, Bruce heads into his office, followed by his secretary, MARGARET.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The society matrons of Gotham have called a record thirty-two times. Not to mention the press. I think that if they don't know soon who you plan to take to the charity circus, the world will most surely come to an end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce notices an envelope on his desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I didn't see anyone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No postmark. No stamp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce opens the envelope. 142      LETTER - CLOSE. A photo of Bruce. Below: letters newspapers and magazines read: (RIDDLE#1) (to be written) signed -The Riddler

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 143      Bruce raises an eyebrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Riddler? Why can't anyone in this town have a normal name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phone RINGS. Bruce hits a switch and a desk video-phone lights into life. Alfred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Channel 12, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce presses a button and Alfred's image shrinks to a small box in the corner, superimposed atop a TV picture.

dialogues.speaker: ON SCREEN -
dialogues.text: A talk show in progress. A radiant black host: VONDELLE MILLIONS talks to a panel of experts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --joined us, we're talking about the mutilation of Lady Gotham, caused late last night by Batman-

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: _Excuse_ me?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- will take up to nine months to repair. Today's topic: Batman-crime- fighter or criminal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How 'bout Two-Face? Anyone here heard of him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shot WIDENS to reveal the panel. 146      ON SCREEN - Our first expert: DR. JANISLAUS ROYC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Batman is a major cause of crime in Gotham. So-called super-villains seek him out hoping to prove themselves in violent conflict. Batman does not deter crime, he invites it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure our audience objects to your gender bias. Batperson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The second expert PIPES in, DR. DAVID AIMS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is the Dark Knight's credo? Batman does not kill? What of those slain during his fight with Jack Napier aka Joker? Or in his Christmas conflict with the orphan Cobblepot? Batman belongs behind bars, not his morally disadvantaged victims.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bull (bleep)!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chase sits at the end of the panel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which part of the word didn't you understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 148      Watching, Bruce sits a little straighter, more h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could like this woman.

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: Batman is a _reaction_ to the crime in this city, not a creator of it! Without him many more would be dead. Batman is a true hero...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Doc, got the hots for Batman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HOOTS and HOLLERS from the audience. CHASE - CLOSE. Busted. 150      On screen, a graphic: BATMAN: CRIMEFIGHTER OR CR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think? Call us at...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HAND reaches up and SNAPS off the TV. The screen goes black to reveal a reflection in the glass: Two-Face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two-Face turns away, disgusted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Batman, Batman, Batman. God, we want that man's blood on our hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LEATHER sits to one side of Harvey. Ruby lipstick, tight leather outfit, a choker o spikes, razor blade earrings, stroking a muzzled black doberman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh you are most obscene, my frightful grotesque.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another set of arms entwine Two-Face. LACE, a submissive blonde in Victoria's Secret's lacy best nuzzles his good side, pets a white kitten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't listen to her. You're every girl's dream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waste Dorothy and Toto here, you and me can get down to business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey SLAPS Leather, hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harder, baby. Hit me again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hotter still) Sadist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns now to Lace, caresses her face gently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two-Face's hideaway, divided straight down the middle. Lace's half is all light and order. Leather's domain looks like an S&M club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too many bats to fry to think about fun. We wanna take him apart limb by hyper-extended limb. Feel his bones crunch in our hands. Beat him until he's as black and blue as that ridiculous rubber suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without thinking, Harvey steps over the Laceland. His demeanor instantly changes, now more reasoned and calm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the other hand, perhaps something slow, a delicious incursion of despair, a campaign to shatter his psyche and bring him crumbling to his knees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wanders back across to Leatherland.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell. Why wait? Rupture his organs. Shatter his spine. Still have time for a late dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back in Laceland.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But simple murder? It's just too damn simple. Besides, it's been done. No. We need a plan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back to Leatherland.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Something senseless, brutal, savage, violent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back to Laceland, stopping to add...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yet witty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward peddles a bicycle down a service road towards Wayne Manor, an envelope jutting from his shirt pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alfred stands over a cage of bats. A hand-held scanner producing distance readings. Bruce sits before his Master Console.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's the sonar coming, Alfred?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few hitches sir, but I'm confident we'll have a prototype in no time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll never work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe you said the same thing about the Batmobile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (OVER) a doorbell RINGS. Alfred disappears upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Bruce works a keyboard, manipulating the images on various screens. 155      SCREEN ONE - Replays the CNN story on Two-Face 156      SCREEN TWO - Replays the Vondelle Williams show. 157      SCREEN THREE - Runs news footage of Chase. 158      As Alfred returns, Bruce splits the Chase screen of psychiatric texts scrolling beside her portrait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scholarly research?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She has an excellent mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I misinterpreted your interest in the lady, I humbly apologize--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wonder if she'd go out with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Apology hastily retracted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce freezes the image of Vondelle Williams over the familiar graphic: Batman: Crimefighter or Criminal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They don't understand. They think I became Batman to fight crime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce leans back, closes his eyes, his past never far.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you remember the night I fell into that cave and the bat chased me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your parents' wake. Rain fell like tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...The night Batman was born. (a beat) What was I doing in the fields that night, Alfred? What sent me running out into that storm? I keep dreaming about it but I just can't remember.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, sir. Your dear parents.  Suddenly gone. So much loss...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I remember the bat, though. His scream. Those eyes. i was sure the fear would kill me. (a beat) In time I came to believe that if I became a monster, that if I was feared, I wouldn't be scared anymore. I was wrong. (off the screen) They think I became Batman to fight crime. I became Batman to fight the fear. And instead I became the fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alfred hands him an envelope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps it's time you paid a bit more attention to Bruce Wayne. There was no one at the door, just this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Within, (RIDDLE #2). His expression darkens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The source of the POUNDING -- MRS. LUCERTOLA, Ed's middle-aged, no-bullshit landlady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ya wanna cough up your rent, or do I post an eviction notice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Locks TURN. The door opens a crack. Edward peeks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Lucertola. What a surprise. Come in. I was just sitting down to write the check.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Lucertola barges inside -- then stops, aghast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five people might live here. Sports magazines. Stock market tickers. Half completed paintings and sculptures. Blueprints. In the corner an old circus booth containing a manikin of the green-clad, can wielding Guesser.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it exactly that you do, Mr. Nygma?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My dear Ms. Lucertola. Italian, isn't it? For lizard. How fitting. I think the question better asked: what is it that I don't do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed guides Mrs. Lucertola to a sofa before the TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most recently I have devised a way to change the destiny of mankind and the world as we know it, all in my favor of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rent Nygma!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Might I persuade you to take a seat on this couch? To indulge me in a little experiment?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shoves her down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I got no time for-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward clamps a new, streamlined headband on her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Showtime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He clicks on the TV. An evening soap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My favorite story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Atop the TV rests a small box. The next generation of his Remote Encephalographic Stimulator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. TV. Balm to the minds of the masses. The great deadener. If only it were more lively. But wait. I can help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hits a switch on the Box and the familiar beam engulfs his landlady, the holographic image of the screen's kissing couple now hovering in mid-air before her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my lord.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not quite. But I'm getting there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 162      MRS. LUCERTOLA - POV - She might as well be sitt foot of the bed as the two lovers' embrace heats up. Edward waves his hand in front of her eyes. Nothing. The same dazed expression that Stickley wore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now this is much better. No pain. Just a little holographic TV to keep your mind off the fact...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward PLANTS an ELECTRODE on his forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...That I'm taking your mind. (professional) Not your thoughts, mind you. Just your neural energy, simply sucking some IQ points as it were.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GREEN-BLUE aura forms around Edward's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (announcer) His intelligence jumps. Ms. Lizard don't know it. The crowd goes wild.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boys, I want one of these babies in every home. (Clinton) It's the new information super highway and, pay attention now kids. I'm the on ramp. (ad-man) From their brains to the TV to my brain, with no commercial interruptions! (announcer) There are seven million brains in the Naked City... (menacing) ...and they're all mine!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gothic. Active. Bruce enters the complex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Comfortable. Well appointed. Degrees on the walls. Chase opens her door to Bruce Wayne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Wayne. Chase Meridian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sparks he felt from her as Batman don't fly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can I help you, Mr. Wayne?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody's been sending me love letters. Commissioner Gordon thought you might give me your expert opinion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chase spread the `Riddler' letters before her. Bruce TAPS his fingers absentmindedly as he watches her read.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Psychiatrists make you nervous?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just ones this beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The infamous Wayne charm. Does it ever shut off?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On occasion. Usually at night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce stops tapping, examines books on aberrant behavior. The Dark Side. Turns a tiny wicker doll over in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still play with dolls, Doctor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's a Malaysian dream warden. She stands sentry while you sleep and calms your dreams. (off Bruce's expressions) Need one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me? No. Only things that need calming in my dreams are the Rockettes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chase holds his eyes a beat. Not buying. But she lets it go, looks back over the letters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My opinion. This letter writer is a total wacko.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wacko? That a technical term?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patient apparently suffers from acute obsessional syndrome with potential homicidal styles. Work better for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what you're saying, this guy's a total wacko, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a slight smile) Exactly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He notices batman research on her desk.  Spots a framed print hanging on the wall. A bat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have a thing for bats?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chase follows his gaze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a rorschach, Mr. Wayne. People see what they want to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce looks back up. In fact, just an ink blot. Only he saw a bat within it's bleeding lines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think the question would be, do you have a thing for bats?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, this Riddler, he's dangerous?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you know about obsession?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Obsession is born of fear. Recall a moment of great terror in your life. Say you associate that moment with... (random) ...a bat. The bat's image becomes a cancer of the mind, grows more real than your daily life. Can you imagine something like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a stretch but I'll manage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The letter writer is obsessed with you. His only escape may be...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To kill me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You understand obsession better than you let on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No insights here, doc. Just trying to get comfortable on your couch. (checking his watch) Oops. Times up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's usually my line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I'd love to keep chatting-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you? I'm not so sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I'm going to have to get you out of those clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And into a black dress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce throws her startled expression his best smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me, Doctor, do you like the circus?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Despite herself, Chase smiles back. 165      A SIGN - CLOSE - Gotham Hospital Charity Circus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Immense. On the lapping edge of Gotham Harbor. Searchlights sweep the sky. FLAGS flutter on the Hippodrome's oval roof, Limos spill Gotham's finest. The night of the season.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE FLYING GRAYSONS -- Mother, Father, and two sons all wearing colorful red and green outfits with yellow cape- -- race out to greet the crowd. They discard their capes, cartwheel to four guywires.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen. Seventy feet above the ground, performing feats of aerial skill without a net, the Flying Graysons!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights dim. Spots follow each Grayson as hoist cables whisk them up to the trapezes and high wire.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE TRAPEZE
dialogues.text: Dad and Chris Grayson hang by their knees, upside down on opposite trapezes. 169      Mom jumps to Chris' hands, hangs in mid-air. Chr back and forth, building momentum, then sends her to Dad in a poetic double somersault.

dialogues.speaker: BELOW
dialogues.text: The Hippodrome is packed solid.

dialogues.speaker: VIP SECTION
dialogues.text: Bruce and Chase in evening finery take their seats amidst a barrage of flashing photographers. The Gotham Society matrons crowd for a photo op.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off the flashes) I'm surprised you aren't blind by now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as if he were) I'm sorry. Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chase smiles. The Press and Matrons disappear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now we can just sit back and watch the show like normal folks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tonight's benefit has raised $375,000 for Gotham Children's Hospital. Let's thank our largest single donor: Bruce Wayne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SPOTLIGHT finds Bruce and Chase. WILD APPLAUSE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through her smile) Like normal folks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (deadpan) What? This isn't normal?

dialogues.speaker: RINGMASTER
dialogues.text: And now Richard, the youngest Flying Grayson, will perform The _Quadruple_ Flying Somersault!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 173      DICK GRAYSON, handsome, only happy when he is in jumps to his father's hands, hangs in air. 174      DICK'S POV - The world flips, dizzying, four tim 175      Chris catches Dick's hands. Shaky. One hand slip The Crowd GASPS. Dick dangles for an instant. 176      Chris hoists Dick to safety. An uproarious OVATI 177      CHASE watches Bruce. He's riveted, eyes like a c

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That kid is amazing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't get you Bruce Wayne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me? I'm easy. Especially after a couple of martinis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The glib, cavalier routine, it really is an act, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't believe it. I'm just skin deep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he holds her eyes and in the smile that passes between them, sweet electricity. Maybe something more. 178      THE RINGMASTER stands watching the Graysons feat aerial wonder. Something catches his eye. 179      A GLOVED HAND extends through the curtain leadin backstage, beckons him with a single finger. 180      THE RINGMASTER - CLOSE. Puzzled. Steps out of th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I'm rock climbing Sunday. How about coming along?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce, much to my surprise, you seem like a really great guy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I met someone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fast work. You just moved here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could say he kind of dropped out of the sky and bang-. I think he felt it too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sure did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (awkward) I said I'm sure he did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce looks towards...

dialogues.speaker: CENTER RING
dialogues.text: A TINY CAR, horn HONKING away, ROARS into the middle ring and begins dislodging clowns, all tumbling out of the cars and over each other. 183      A new Ringmaster steps into the arena. Two-Face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen, and I do use the term loosely, your attentions please. Tonight, a new act for your amusement. We call it Massacre Under the Big Top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 184      His thugs slip out of their clown costumes and s exit. 185      They pull machine guns and start SHOOTING over t audience's heads. PANIC. SCREAMS.

dialogues.speaker: TWO-FACE
dialogues.text: People, people. Show some grace under pressure. A little decorum, please. (into his mike) _SHUT UP_!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 187      More machine gun BURSTS as Thugs move into sentr positions at each section of bleachers. Folks quiet.

dialogues.speaker: TWO-FACE
dialogues.text: If we may direct your attention...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 189/90   A Thug trains a spot on a crate hung in the raft

dialogues.speaker: TWO-FACE
dialogues.text: Inside that wooden box: two hundred sticks of TNT. (showing a box) In our hand: a radio detonator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two-Face presses a button. 192      DETONATOR - CLOSE. A digital countdown. 3:00. 2:

dialogues.speaker: TWO-FACE
dialogues.text: You have three minutes.

dialogues.speaker: THE MAYOR
dialogues.text: What the hell do you want?

dialogues.speaker: TWO-FACE
dialogues.text: Want, Mr. Mayor? Just one little thing. Batman. Bruised. Broken. Bleeding. In a word: dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two-Face turns, showing his good side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who do we have assembled before us? Gotham's finest. Rich, Influential. Smart. One of you must know who Batman is. Hell, we'd lay odds one of you _is_ Batman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two-Face spins, offers his evil side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, unless the bat is surrendered to us post haste, we're off on a proverbial killing spree. City wide mayhem and murder. Starting tonight. With all you lovely folks as our very first corpses to be. You have three ---well just under three--- minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 196      BRUCE, his eyes riveted on the bomb. No secret i innocent lives. He stands. Chase, misunderstanding, tries to pull Bruce back down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly everyone jumps up, SHOUT and SCREAM, point towards the rafters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Graysons scale the scaffolding, heading for the bomb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boys! Move, move, move! (a beat) Cannot get good help these days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 198      Any Thugs not standing sentry fan out, speed up

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: (to Dick) Go! We'll hold them off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, Dad and Chris swing from trapeze to guywire to platform, trying to delay the Thugs who are actually well-trained gymnasts. 200      Dick launches himself from trapeze to trapeze, b off the high wire, grabs a catwalk and hoists himself up. 201      Bruce uses the distraction to hop the rail, race the SCREAMING CROWD. 202      THE TIME - CLOSE. 1:03. 1:02. 1:01.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE TRAPEZE
dialogues.text: 204      A Thug grabs Dad Grayson by the leg. Dad manages to another trapeze. 205      Mom's not so lucky. A Thug punches her off the u platform. She falls in mid-air. 206      FOLKS in the audience SCREAM. 207      BRUCE moves fast towards one of the sentry Thugs 208      MOM snags a wildly swinging trapeze with one leg her ankle around a rope, hanging over the floor. 209      A THUG points to the Time Clock  0:45. 0:44. 0:4 210      THE THUGS quit the fight, slide down ropes and g 211      DAD AND CHRIS form a human chain to reach Mom. D anchors Chris who swings out towards Mom. Mom swings her trapeze to gather momentum.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE RAFTERS
dialogues.text: Dick has reached the Bomb. Begins un-lashing the crate.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE CIRCUS FLOOR
dialogues.text: The Thugs begin to pour through the trap door. A few thrill-seekers fire their MACHINE GUNS over the crowd. 214      THE TIMER - CLOSE. 0:15. 0:14. 0:13. 215      DICK scales a service ladder, vies with a roof h

dialogues.speaker: TRAPEZE
dialogues.text: Dan and Chris make their final swing. Mom lets go and sails gloriously towards Chris. Below them, no net. 217      BRUCE taps the watching Thug on the shoulder. He

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show's over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A punch and the guy is out. Bruce starts for Two-Face. Another Thug springs up before him, blocking his way. 218      TWO-FACE stares up at the dangling Graysons. He into his pocket. Pulls out a familiar coin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Day in, day out, it always comes down to the same old question. Life... (flips the coin) Or death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks down. Scarred side up. He draws his gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our kinda day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 219      BRUCE fells the other Thug. Starts to sprint acr ring towards Two-Face.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE ROOF
dialogues.text: Dick shoves the hatch open, climbs out. 221      TIMER - CLOSE. 0:10. 0:09. 0:08. 222      MOM spots the pointing gun far below. She SCREAM 223      BRUCE races for the aiming Two-Face. Almost ther Another Thug hits him broadside, knocking him flat. 224      TWO-FACE FIRES. Twice, the first bullet cutting, 225      second severing the rope that holds the Graysons

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never did like the circus. Too many freaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 226/27   Two-Face disappears down the tunnel. Bruce strug to his feet. A CHARGE blows inside the escape hatch, filling the access-way with fire. No way out. 228      CLOCK - CLOSE. 0:07. 0:06.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dick scrambles onto the roof, begins whipping the bomb rope like a sling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dick let's fly, the bomb soaring out towards the harbor. 232      THE BOMB hits the water. Sinks. A beat. The nigh split by a funneling EXPLOSION.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dick swings excitedly down onto the catwalk. He freezes at the rail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DICK - CLOSE. On his face, his life's end.

dialogues.speaker: STRAIGHT DOWN
dialogues.text: The dead bodies of his mother, father and brother. Bruce Wayne stands over them, looking up at the boy. 235      BRUCE - CLOSE. His face a tragic echo of Dick's

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A police car heads towards the manor. Dick Grayson, pack on his back, winds his motorcycle behind the cruiser. Bruce comes out to greet Gordon. Dick, slightly awestruck, dismounts, wanders into the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's good of you to take him in. He's been filling out forms all day. He hasn't even eaten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce nods, watches Gordon drive off. Heads into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Bruce ENTERS through the open door, Alfred arrives from the other direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome, Master Grayson. I'm Alfred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How ya doin', Al?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mouthing) Al?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Bruce) Big house. How many rooms?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gee, I'm not sure. (across the foyer) Alfred? How many rooms? Total?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ninety-three, including the sauna.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take any three you like. After you get settled we can...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 238/39   But Dick isn't listening, stares instead over Bruce's shoulder as Gordon's cruiser disappears out of sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. I'm outta here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I figure telling that cop I'd stay here saved me a truckload of social service interviews and good will. So no offense but thanks. See ya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dick heads toward the door. Alfred slips away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where will you go? The circus is halfway to Metropolis by now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got no place at the circus without my family. I'm going to get a fix on Two-Face. Then I'm going to kill him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, Dick. Killing Two-Face won't take the pain away. It'll make it worse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, spare me the sermons, okay. You're just some rich guy who is trying to do a good deed. You don't even know me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce stares beyond Dick, into his own past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not just the sadness. Is it? The shame is worse. Feeling like somehow you should have saved them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dick is looking at Bruce now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right. I don't know you. But I'm like you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then Alfred returns with a tray. Rare London broil. Baby potatoes. Fresh greens. An aromatic feast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, is the young master leaving? Pity. I'll just toss this away then. Perhaps the dogs are hungry -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alfred turns, heads up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll set this up in the guest suite. Just in case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dick follows, led by his nose. Bruce smiles, nods slowly, heads into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce touches a vase of fresh roses. Stares at framed photos of Thomas, Martha, of himself, younger. Happy. With no knowledge of the future. 241      He turns. Suddenly their coffins are in the midd room again, the still corpses white in death. He's a boy. There on the desk. A leather bound book. (OVER) THUNDER CRACKS. 242      THE FRONT DOOR flies open. An evil wind whips th 243      THE BOOK is splattered with blood. 244      THE WINDOW explodes, shattering glass, and out o darkness flies a huge, evil bat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Master Bruce?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 245      Bruce is sitting in a chair, holding a rose, hea the images only flashes of memory. Night has fallen. He looks up, eyes. red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's happening again. Just like my parents. A monster comes out of the night. A scream. Two gunshots. I killed them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He killed them. Two-Face. He slaughtered that boy's parents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. You said I. I killed them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be ridiculous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly a pale light through the window illuminates the room, bathes their faces. 246      THE BATSIGNAL beams in the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dick Grayson finishes eating. He moves into the

dialogues.speaker: HALLWAY
dialogues.text: the house seems empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey?..  Hello?... Anybody home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Batman speeds along in the Batmobile. He hits top speed as the car's fusion drive glows red. 250      A giant projector, beaming the Batsignal on the night clouds. Batman leaps from a neighboring roof to find no one. Just the huge light and the city wind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commissioner...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shadow appears from behind the searchlight. Chase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's home. I sent the signal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last night at the circus. I noticed something about Dent. His coin. He's obsessed with justice. It's his Achilles' heel. It can be exploited.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He steps close to her. Intimidating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You called me here for this? The Batsignal is not a beeper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Instead of backing off, Chase moves towards him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish I could say my interest in you was purely professional...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you trying to get under my cape, Doctor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A girl cannot live by psychoses alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the car, right? Chicks love the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
