dialogues.text: What is it about the wrong kind of man? In grade school it was guys with earrings. College, motorcycles and leather jackets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chase is right up against him. She runs her fingers along the outline of Batman's mask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now black rubber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try a fireman. Less to take off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't mind the work. Pity I can't see behind the mask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Batman stills her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We all wear masks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My life's an open book. You read?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not the kind of guy who blends in at a family picnic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We could give it a try. I'll bring the wine, you bring the scarred psyche.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are direct, aren't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like strong women. I've done my homework. Or do I need skin-tight vinyl and a whip?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their bodies are close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't had much luck with women...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you just haven't met the right woman...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their mouths are close. Suddenly Commissioner Gordon, trench-coat over pajamas, rushes onto the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw the beacon. What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing... False alarm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 251      Batman shoots a Batarang into the night and dive the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SIRENS WHINE as two cruisers fly down a pot-holed street. 253      ANGLE ON - A bridge structure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is dark. POLICE SIRENS FADE as a trap door opens in the floor. Two-Face emerges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ever have one of those days where you just want to kill someone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riddle me this. (Riddle #3)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A mysterious silhouette stands in the dark. Two-Face draws his gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The answer is, your enemy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can just call me... The Riddler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The figure steps out of shadow. A new costume, lime green, covered with question marks, an emerald eye mask, derby and cane. An exact replica of the Guesser's outfit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you find us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You _are_ Two-Face, you would need to face both rivers, both uptown and downtown simultaneously. Only one spot in Gotham serves these bi- zonal, bi-coastal needs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations. You get to die on the dean's list.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two-Face trains his gun, COCKS the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Has anyone ever told you have a serious impulse control problem? (looking around) You know, I simply love what you've done with this place. Heavy Metal with just a touch of House and Garden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He crosses to Leatherland.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's so dark and Gothic and disgustingly decadent...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves to Laceland.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yet so bright and chipper and conservative! (to "bad" side) It's so you. ("good" side) And yet so _you_! (touching his suit) Very few people are both a summer _and_ a winter. But you pull it off nicely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man with a death wish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey. You need me. Since you've gotten out of Arkham, you've managed, what? To bungle stealing a safe? Wreck a statue? And, correct me if I'm wrong here, but weren't you outsmarted by an acned acrobat at the circus?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's see if you bleed green.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two-Face COCKS back the hammer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, counselor. Go ahead. Fire away. But before you do, let me ask you one question. Is it really me you want to kill?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Riddler knits his thumbs together, waves his hands over one of the exposed light bulbs that illuminate the room, making a shadow on the wall. The shadow of a bat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know about hate, my dual visaged friend? Slow, burning hate that keeps you sleepless until late in the night, that wakes you before dawn. Do you know that kind of hate? I do. (circling Harvey) Kill him? Seems like a good enough idea. But have you thought it through? A few bullets, a quick spray of blood, a fast, thrilling rush, and then what? Wet hands and post-coital depression. Is it really enough? (up close) Why not ruin him first? Expose his frailty. And then, when he is at his weakest, crush him in your hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 255      Riddler gestures to the front of the room, where and Lace, on their respective sides, are fixed to their TV's via the green beam of the box. He tosses a receiver electrode to Two-Face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Take a hit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two-Face looks at the electrode curiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taps his forehead) Up, up, up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat. Then, gun still trained on the Riddler, Two-Face holds the receiver to his skull. He's blasted with a dose of Leather and Lace's neural energy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So not everyone can be a poet. Still, I respect the sentiment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riddler waves his hand in front of the girls' eyes. No response. Definitely zoned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the girls) This is your brain on the box. (off Harvey) This is your brain on their brain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He plants an electrode on his own forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is my brain on your brain on their brain. Does anybody else feel like a fried egg?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Riddler grabs Two-Face's receiver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Wait...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Addictive isn't it? Just Say No. Until I say yes. A little fringe benefit of working with me. Now here's the concept, counselor. Crime. My I.Q., your AK-47. You help me gather production capital so I can produce enough of these (pulling a Box from his vest) to create an empire that will eclipse Bruce Wayne's forever. And, in return I will help you solve the greatest riddle of all. Who is Batman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two-Face eyes The Riddler, interest dawning in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are a very strange person. You speak as if we are old friends, which we are not. You barge in here unarmed when it is clearly suicidal to do so. Still, an intriguing proposition. (pulling his coin) Heads: we take your offer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rests the barrel on The Riddler's temple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tails: we blow your _goddamned head off_!

dialogues.speaker: FOLLOW THE COIN
dialogues.text: as Two-Face FLIPS it high in the air... SPINNING...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thugs grab handfuls of gems as a Guard presses the ALARM BUTTON. LOONY TOONS and MERRIE MELODIES THEMES play as Riddler's animated face fills the surveillance screens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Riddler and Two-Face stand over a palette of black jeweler's felt. Littered with bright, sparkling diamonds. The Riddler slips on a monocle, lifts a stone. Two-Face grabs the entire palette, pours the diamonds into a loot bag, heads towards another counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WINDSCREEN - CLOSE. A flashing message: Crime In Progress 259      An ever changing tactical map shows Batman's nar proximity to the crime site.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Batmobile rushes to a halt. Batman leaps out, SMASHES through a door into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Girls LAUGH and flirt. Even behind his mask, Batman fumes. Obviously misled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce sits watching the news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...working with Two-Face, Gotham's new criminal mastermind is calling himself The Riddler.  Twenty million in diamonds were stolen yesterday with no sign of Batman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 263      SCREEN - CLOSE. Changes. Edward stands on the Cl A small abandoned island in Gotham Harbor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In other news, entrepreneur Edward Nygma has signed a lease for Claw Island. Nygma says he plans to break ground on an electronics plant....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Armored trucks sit open on the street. Two-toned thugs carry out bags of loot. Two-Face and the Riddler stand before four guards, each sentry held captive by a two-toned crony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close your fist. Reach back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two-Face swings, clocks the guard on the chin. CRACK. Out like a light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riddler nods tentatively. Manages a weak fist. Throws a feeble punch. The Guard looks barely startled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riddler. You punch like a girl. Put some heart into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two-Face hauls off, hits the third Guard. Out he goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Okay. I got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leans way back, tries again. Barely a glancing blow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks away, shaking his head, disgusted. The Riddler turns back to the guard. Ready for another try.

dialogues.speaker: PULL BACK TO REVEAL
dialogues.text: Alfred, newspaper in hand, finds Dick trying to open the door which leads to the Bat Cave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I help you, Master Grayson?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How come this is the only locked door around this museum? What's back there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Master Wayne's dead wives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dick grins. Alfred watches him go, a wry smile on his face. The coast now clear, he disappears into the secret doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dick stands hidden in an alcove, watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tremendous construction in progress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silhouettes of robot arms manufacture the Box. Edward watches on, giving Two-Face a quick hit from a glowing electrode, then snatches back the receiver. Harvey eyes the electrode with an addict's hungry eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two-Face and Thugs steal priceless paintings while the Guards sit bound and gagged in their booth. Riddler stares up at a freshly spray-painted (RIDDLE #4) on the boat's hull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dick stands watching TV while he washes and dries his clothes using martial arts techniques.

dialogues.speaker: VONDELLE, (ON SCREEN)
dialogues.text: Has Batman lost his touch? We've become a city of sissies crying Batman, Batman, Batman at the first sign of trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Barber of Seville is in full swing. As the bejewelled audience watches, the translation is being spelled out for them on a large electronic screen over the stage.

dialogues.speaker: BACKSTAGE
dialogues.text: Green gloved hands attach a Box to the translator.

dialogues.speaker: AUDIENCE
dialogues.text: The familiar green beam of The Box transfixes the audience and the performers. Two-Face and his Thugs take the balcony in protective green sunglasses, strip folks of their cash and jewels. 276      The Riddler stands on stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just love a captive audience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He picks up the ARIA A-CAPELLA, races through the stunned orchestra, collecting valuables. As he goes, he moves the mouths of his victims, turning the robbery into an opera of his own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing) Oh, but all I want is to take all your jewels oh oh. (moving a woman's mouth) No, oh you villain don't take my jewels, oh no. (singing back) I will. (a man's mouth) No you won't. (singing) I will. (another man) No you won't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 277      Still SINGING, he leaps back onto the stage wher and his Thugs arrive, bags full of loot. Riddler plays tiny hidden buttons in his cane, directing Batman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you sending Batboy this time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here. Get a good seat.

dialogues.speaker: OUT THE WINDOW
dialogues.text: The Batmobile makes a quick stop before the opera house. 279      Riddler, Two-Face and Thugs disappear just as...

dialogues.speaker: BATMAN
dialogues.text: drops to the Stage from the ceiling. He looks around at the stunned audience. He spots a small box with a question mark on it sitting center stage. Lifts the top. Within, a pair of plastic hands applaud him. 280      THE TRANSLATOR - CLOSE. Vaporizes, the beam snap

dialogues.speaker: THE AUDIENCE
dialogues.text: startled by Batman's sudden appearance on stage, starts LAUGHING. Until someone notices her tiara is missing. A SCREAM. The first of many.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Electronic headlines circles- BAT FLOPS AT OPERA. RIDDLER AND TWO-FACE STEAL MILLIONS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally complete. In the b.g. a giant corporate sign reading NYGMATECH is raised by cranes. Edward Nygma, dressed like Bruce Wayne to the smallest detail, stands on a podium, giving a press conference. Scores of APPLAUDING Employees and Media watch on. The Gotham Society Matrons COO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why sit back when you can be part of the show?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Nygmatech brings the joy 3-D entertainment into your own home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 285      CUTS OF MAGAZINES all proclaiming Edward as the of Electronics in Gotham City.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen. Let me tell you my vision for the future. "The Box" in every home in America. And one day, the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tenement, where a poor family scrapes together their savings on a newspaper ad for "The Box".... 287      An electronics store, where Alfred, at the head line, hands over a check to receive "The Box"... 288      A resplendent household where husband, wife, and each watch individual TV's connected to their own Boxes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riddler sits atop a tremendous electronic throne, facing a wall bank of TV monitors all running newsreel footage of folks using "The Box". From overhead, a giant diode delivers massive pulses of glowing neural energy. 290      RIDDLER'S HEAD - CLOSE. His brain is growing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crowds of people line up. Some stores say "SOLD OUT" others "YES, WE HAVE `THE BOX'."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce stands over the Batcomputer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riddler and Two-Face are tweaking the data before the computer pulls it off the emergency bands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alfred stands in his lab area, trying to disassemble "The Box". He gets the lid off. 293      BOX - CLOSE. The circuitry inside automatically

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leather and Lace sit with the Riddler and Two-Face as the two villains pass an electrode between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, E = MC squared. Until you factor in more than three dimensions. Then... Damn. Hit us again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haven't you had enough? Don't Think And Drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey waves his revolver in Riddler's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be my guest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two-Face and Leather and Lace take another hit of the glowing neural energy. Smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our Paleolithic yearnings are best expressed in a pre-linguistic- (off the befuddled girls) Sorry. Just thinking out loud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey leans back, buzzed, the electrode slipping from his hand. Leather grabs for it. Not fast enough. Riddler snatches it away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Leather) Not until you do that thing I like. (taking a hit) On se tue pour des mesnonges. J'ai gache ma vie... (off the electrode) Woah. Harsh toke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't bogart that 'trode.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tosses Harv the electrode over Lace's ill-timed grab. Harvey takes a hit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (epiphanous) Oh my God. Jim Morrison was right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (simultaneous) ...Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: TV
dialogues.text: Vondelle stands before the familiar panel of experts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This Box is nothing more than an electronic narcotic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thousands more Gothamites each day are tuning out by tuning in to its holographic fantasies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's turning citizens into zombies...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gripe, gripe, gripe. Isn't this what they said about TV? I think "The Box" is the future. What's your opinion? I want to know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 296      FAVOR Alfred as he shuts off the set, moves into 297      hallway and the locked door to the Batcave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling out) Master Dick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: High above, Dick appears on the third floor landing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up here, Al.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just checking, young sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) Four seconds from...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Below, Alfred opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alfred disappears inside and the door begins to close. Dick leaps the bannister, grabs the chandelier, swings to a large tapestry, slides down and into the passageway as the door SLAMS shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unable to stop, Dick barrels through a dark doorway, tumbles down the long stairway onto

dialogues.speaker: THE BATCAVE FLOOR
dialogues.text: Alfred stands in his lab area. The two stare at each other in utter disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big. Open. A life still in boxes. The door opens, producing Bruce and Chase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The style of the letters I'm getting matches those found at the crime sites. Why would The Riddler be sending me riddles? (looking around) Who's your decorator? U-Haul?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. I haven't even had time to unpack. Instant coffee okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chase disappears into the kitchen as Bruce takes off his coat. She reappears with a small box. Hands it to Bruce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce opens the box. Within, a dream doll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call it clinical intuition. I thought your dreams might need changing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce looks at Chase. He stares out the window a beat, deciding. As he speaks now his words are halting, self disclosure difficult for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My parents were murdered. In front of me. I was just a kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chase nods. She knows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lot of what happened is jagged. Pieces missing. I can't really remember. I just get flashes. Usually in my dreams. I'd kind of gotten used to them. At least accepted them....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've changed. The dreams, I mean. There's a new element I don't understand. A book. Black. Covered in leather....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (OVER) The kettle begins to WHISTLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn. I'll be right back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce is agitated, starts to looking around. At her desk he finds a virtual shrine to Batman. Pictures. Newsphotos. Articles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find anything interesting?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do I feel like the other man, here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Bruce. This is what I do for a living.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd say this goes a little beyond taking your work home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want me to say? That I'm not attracted to him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 301      She hits a button and on screen newsfootage roll Batman fighting Catwoman.

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: (mesmerized) Look at the abuse he's taking. He's not just fighting criminals. He's punishing himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chase hits a button, freezing on Batman's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's as if he's paying some great penance. What crime could he have committed to deserve a life sentence of such agony?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce hits a key, blanking the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe he just had a lousy childhood, is that it Doc?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chase grabs his hand as it comes away from the keyboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Throw up that ridiculous superficial mask. If you're jealous...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me close but you won't let me near. What's the terrible, dark secret you're protecting everyone from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the mirror they are half in shadow, half in light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a sense we are all two people. The side we show in daylight. And that side we keep in shadow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rage. Anger. Passion. Pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls her to him. Their faces are close. A breath apart. Suddenly his watch begins to BEEP. 303/04   Bruce turns over his wrist. Depresses a stud on his watch. The face turns into a screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry to bother you, sir. I have some rather distressing news about Master Dick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid Master Dick has... gone traveling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He ran away?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, he took the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He boosted the Jag? (relieved) Is that all?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not the Jaguar. The _other_ car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The _Rolls_?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: _No_, sir. _The_ _other_ _car_!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat. Then Bruce closes his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gotham night life. Neon, traffic, sleaze. The Batmobile cruises into the center of the strip. A group of flashy low riders pull in front of the Batmobile. They hydraulic up and down competitively. The Batmobile wipers sweep the windshield. The bat-foil opens and closes. Finally the car hydraulics higher and faster, but a bit wildly, the driver barely in control. 306      The low riders, put to shame, PEEL OUT. (OVER) A cuts the night. A GIRL runs for her life, chased by SIX GANG MEMBERS into a dark alley. The Batmobile TEARS after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Thugs have the Girl surrounded, push her back and forth between them like a rag doll. The Batmobile SCREECHES into the alley. The door slides open. From the smoking hatchway emerges...Dick. Needless to say, this get the Thugs' attention. They let go of the girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the hell are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (low, ominous) I'm Batman. (looking down) Damn, did I forget to dress again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Thugs close. One rushes Dick while another swings a chain at his head. Mistake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chains. You don't seem like the type.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dick's hand shoots out fast, grabbing the chain. He open palms the Thug in the chin, whips the chain into the gut of the other villain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Caped Crusader strikes again. Sans cape, of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two more rush him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another victory for the Dark Knight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dick goes up with a flying front kick, knocking one down, fells another on the return with a spinning back fist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off the unconscious goons) Dark nighty-night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dick stares at the remaining thug. Smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is your will up to date?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The last Thug takes a look at Dick, turns and races away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could definitely get behind this super hero gig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dick nods to the awestruck Girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma'am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts towards the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She moves close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You forgot the part where you kiss the girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grinning) Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leans in, happy to oblige when suddenly... (OVER) SCREAMS AND SHOUTS as the Thug who got away comes racing back into the alley, followed by maybe thirty new gang members, all wielding bats and chains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls the girl behind him, readies for war.

dialogues.speaker: A DARK FIGURE
dialogues.text: flies out of the night. Batman, on a wire, swings into the group, sending them scattering in all directions. The bad guys race off.

dialogues.speaker: THE BATMOBILE
dialogues.text: REVS UP, races to Batman. 310      Batman lifts Dick by his collar, drops him into passenger seat. Hops into the other side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting) Don't you want my number?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She watches as the Batmobile speeds away into the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce and Dick argue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to be part of this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me and my brother Chris were putting money aside so our folks could retire. Dad's knee was going. Chris was engaged, you know that? Two-Face took...everything. Now I can pay him back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I do isn't about revenge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dick glances at a framed headline. The Wayne murders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right, slick. Whatever you say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce grabs him. Hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't a game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dick pushes him off. Harder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back off, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't understand. It's an addiction. You fight night after night, trying to fill the emptiness. But the pain's back in the morning. And somewhere along the way it stops being a choice. (a beat) I want better for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Save the sermons about how great you want my life to be, okay, Bruce? If it weren't for Batman my parents wouldn't be dead. You don't get it, do you? This is all your fault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dick storms out. Bruce stares after him with tired eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the marble entrance, the red carpet is rolled out for a pull-out-the-stops party. Over the door, a banner proclaims "Nygmatech -- Imagine the Future." At the curb folks dressed in over-the-top runway fashions, pour from luxury cars, hand off keys to a battalion of scurrying valets. Next car up -- Bruce Wayne's Rolls, driven by Alfred. A valet helps Chase out. She looks stunning. Bruce leans over Alfred before stepping out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too much wealth. Too fast. Half of Gotham zombied-out. A technology that self destructs. He's protecting more than industrial secrets, Alfred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I shall be near at hand. Should you need me. And sir, I know it's difficult but try and have a good time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over the top golden glitz. A kind of Versailles meets punk meets couture. And in the middle, Edward, dressed as Louis XIV. The room is packed with people sipping exotic cocktails, munching hors d'oeuvres. Conversation BUZZ is high. Into this zoo walk Bruce and Chase. As brightly-lighted stations throughout the room, showy displays announce "THE NEW BOX". Pretty, barely-clad showgirls invite partygoers step into various green columns of light. 314      Bruce scans the room as he and Chase pause by th display, where a Socialite steps into a column of energy. She GASPS with delight as she finds herself suddenly dazzling in diamonds from head to toe. 315      They pass the next column where a CHUBBY PROFESS in hand, fights off a knight on horseback. 316      They pass the next display where a BALD GUY step beam. Suddenly, he is in a classic stoner's pad circa 1967. And, best of all, he has long flowing hair. Chase looks amused, Bruce suspicious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I didn't know better, I'd say you were sulking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep me off the couch, Doc. Your fees are a little rich for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Touchy, touchy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not biting) So how goes your `scholarly' pursuit of Batman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God, Bruce. You're still jealous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flaring) Spare me the diagnosis, okay? You're being ridiculous. I can't be jealous of Batman. (to himself) Can I?

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS THE ROOM
dialogues.text: Edward stands flanked by Gotham's Society Matrons as PRESS, including Vondelle Millions, SNAP photos and hurl questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're outselling Wayne Enterprises. Any comments?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, I'm outselling Wayne Tech two to one...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Times has named you Gotham's bachelor of the year. What do you have to say about that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You might want to ask Bruce Wayne. (calling) Bruce, old man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 318      Edward crosses the room to greet Chase and Bruce stand now, surrounded by press and partygoers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So glad you could come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Oh, Edward. Hi. Congratulations. Great party-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The press were just wondering what it feels like to be outsold, outclassed, and generally outdone in every way... (noticing Chase) And what light through yonder window breaks? `Tis the east. And you are...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (charmed) Chase?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course you are. And what a grand pursuit you must be. (to Bruce) What do you think of my new invention?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Oh, it's very impressive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gracious even in defeat. How vaguely disappointing. When all this could have been ours together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward stills a passing waiter and his tray of champagne. Crystal flutes for all. He toasts Chase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No grape could be more intoxicating than you, my dear. But we make due. To your charms. (clinking hers) Skol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (raising his) Nostrovia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pausing) La'chiem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (casual) Slanta.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rinka.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Banzai.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm drinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I notice you've sub-divided your B coupons. Feeling a little light on principle?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, I like to divest just before a major re-capitalization.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't race to the bank. Old regimes crumble every day. Life is a cycle. Remember Yeats; turn, turn the widening gyre. The Falconer cannot hear the Falcon...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finishing the poem) And the beast slouches towards Bethelem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, boys. I'd hate to stop this testosterone flood on my account-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quite right. Shall we dance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And with that, Edward draws Chase onto to dance floor. 319      As Chase and Edward dance in the b.g. Bruce walk one of the displays. Examines a control station for the green beam. Tries to pry open a circuit panel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naughty, naughty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She slaps his hand playfully. Bruce smiles an apology. Looks around. No other choice. He steps into a beam. 320      EDWARD twirls Chase, watches Bruce enter the bea smiles. 321      BRUCE - POV. Colorful planets soar all around hi the beam flashes. There, racing towards him, a giant Bat.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: All beams wink out as GUN FIRE bursts across the room. TWO-FACE and his Thugs stand at every entrance. BRUCE backs away, slips towards a service door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, folks, this is an old- fashioned, low-tech stick-up. We're interested in the basics: jewelry, cash, watches, high-end cellular phones. Hand 'em over nice and easy and no one gets hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two-Face's Thugs charge the room. The crowd SCREAMS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce hand-slides down fire-escapes, hits the alley running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce ducks into the Rolls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emergency, Alfred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A secret panel in the back opens. A Batsuit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Thugs circulate quickly, yanking jewels from ears and necks, grabbing wallets and purses, filling sacks. Ed pushes his way against the crowd, through Two-Face's ring of personal guards and right up to Two-Face's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're ruining my big party. Are you insane? Actually, considering your dual persona, let's just forget the question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're sick of waiting for you to deliver The Bat, Riddle boy. You promised us Batman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patience, oh bifurcated one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Screw patience. We want him dead. (looking around) An nothing brings out The Bat like a little mayhem and murder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh well, in that case. As long as you were going to rob me, you could have at least let me in on the caper. We could have _organized_ this, _planned it_, pre-sold the movie rights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (OVER) the CRASH of breaking glass.

dialogues.speaker: BATMAN
dialogues.text: flies in through a window, kicking a row of Thugs down before he lets go his rope and lands on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harv, babe, I gotta be honest. Your entrance was good. His was better. What's the difference? Showmanship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two-Face shoves Edward away, looking for a clean shot. He FIRES a couple of times, but only destroys an ice sculpture and some liquor bottles. More SCREAMS. 328      One huge Thug charges Batman. Batman heaves him throws him, CRASHING, into a display of stacked Boxes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Batman, Batman, Batman help!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Thug has a gun to his throat. Batman kicks the weapon out of his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Batman.  You're my _God_!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 329      Another Thug has Chase to a wall, hand around he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He head-butts the Thug. The guy goes down. Chase leans up and kisses him, hard and hot on the mouth. The chemistry here is undeniable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Batman spins, goes for another group of Thugs. (OVER) POLICE SIRENS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay boys. Phase two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And with that, he and his Thugs race for the elevator. The doors close. 330      (OVER) CHEERS erupt for Batman as he races onto balcony -- and jumps!

dialogues.speaker: BATMAN'S
dialogues.text: Harvey and Thugs disappear past Under Construction signs, down the stairs of an as yet completed subway station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PARTY GUESTS - POV. Gripping the edges of his cape, Batma glides 60 floors down the skyscraper towards the street. 333      Batman plummets into the construction sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gothic. Deserted. Under construction. Batman hits the platform. BATMAN - POV. Shadows race down the dark tunnel ahead. He pursues.

dialogues.speaker: TUNNEL
dialogues.text: Harvey and Thugs, racing away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bat's right behind us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excellent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wide spiral staircase of scaffolding hugs the walls of a tremendous ventilation shaft. The Thugs race down the steps, knocking out bits of scaffolding as they go, sending entire chunks of already traversed staircase plummeting past them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Batman arrives on a wide platform of scaffolding at the top of the staircase. His cape whips up around him as if from some low infernal wind. 337      BATMAN - POV. Down the fragmenting staircase, at of the shaft, a tremendous fan spins, chewing chunks of falling scaffolding and plaster, spitting plumes of dust.

dialogues.speaker: TWO-FACE
dialogues.text: stands at the bottom of the well. He grabs a rack of scaffolding and wrenches the old aluminum supports away.

dialogues.speaker: THE PLATFORM
dialogues.text: where Batman is standing gives way, planks falling, sending Batman tumbling towards the deadly blades below. 340      BATMAN - POV. The giant whirling blades, coming 341      BATMAN falls, stairways and laughing Thugs whipp His hand shoots out and grabs

dialogues.speaker: A THUG
dialogues.text: by the jacket, wrenching the fabric over the goon's head, jerking him hard into the railing like a human anchor. Batman climbs the struggling Thug like a ladder, leaps onto the staircase, CRACKS the Thug's head on the rail, then races down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: BOTTOM OF THE SHAFT
dialogues.text: The remaining Thugs disappear through a dark doorway. Batman runs past the BEATING fan blades into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark. Steep and sloping. The Thugs are running dead ahead. Without stopping they begin grabbing pieces of debris, flip them under their feet, begin riding down the descending tunnel like snow-boarders. Batman races after them.

dialogues.speaker: THE SNOWBOARDERS
dialogues.text: really are good. They ride the rails. The low gas pipes. Even bank the curving sides of the tunnel. 345      A THUG - CLOSE. Looks back to see Batman closing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as he is clotheslined by a low hanging danger sign. He flies off the snowboard backwards. Out cold. Batman races past him. 346      The end of the tunnel slopes so drastically the at the end seems more a pit than a door. 347      The boarders circle and one by one, drop through bits of filth down a drain. 348      Batman drops into the darkness landing on a smal Beyond a precipitous drop he turns to face...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Years ago this cavernous space glistened with immense Gothic statuary, elaborate tile mosaics, tremendous decorative arches and spectacular cathedral ceilings. No more. Now the giant space, from floor to ceiling is a frozen maelstrom of twisting cast iron trusses, broken steam pipes, fragmented scaffolding and hanging cables. 350      Down these man-made slopes and obstacles ride th snowboarding Thugs. Cruising pipes. Jumping curved faces of statues. Jacking from scaffold to truss. 351      Batman whips a pair of nun-chucks from his belt hanging metal rail, using the chain as a pulley, shoots down a curving rail into the mad dance of twisting steel.

dialogues.speaker: A THUG
dialogues.text: FIRES at him from his whizzing board as it careens along an adjacent piece of scaffolding. 353      BATMAN angles towards him, picking up speed. 354      THE THUG banks off some statuary. Takes a few mo 355      BATMAN shoots around the curve, jumps from one r the next, catches the villain in the face with his boot, and sends him flying. 356      ANOTHER THUG shoots past over head. 357      BATMAN flips onto another pipe, is closing fast, the Thug towards a loop that banks towards the blackness of an abandoned tunnel. He is closing on the Thug. Closer. Closer. 358      Suddenly the Thug, hops to a truss, the rail Bat whipping him around a curve that banks into the mouth of the tunnel. (OVER) GUNSHOTS.

dialogues.speaker: TWO-FACE
dialogues.text: stands in the shadows, FIRING his machine pistol, blowing a hole in the curving rail directly in front of Batman. 360      The RAIL breaks. Batman flies off directly into the dark tunnel. 361      BATMAN - POV. A rushing darkness. He SMASHES int

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two-Face stands staring into the dark with his Thugs. He grabs an aging valve wheel set into the crumbling wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing worse than a bad case of gas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He begins to turn the CREAKING wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long forgotten pipe by Batman begins to HISS a thick purple gas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two-Face swings a grenade launcher before him. Takes a step back. Aims into the tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lights. Camera. Action.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As his Thugs scramble for cover, Two-Face FIRES. The grenade flies into the tunnel, SLAMMING into the gas main. AN EXPLOSION. Suddenly a tremendous secondary EXPLOSION. Debris falls everywhere as the gas ignites, the mouth of the tunnel suddenly brightening into a flaming white fireball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The huge fireball rushes towards Batman. Batman wraps himself in his cape. 366      HAND - CLOSE. As he reaches to his utility belt. stud there. 367      His cape begins to run and flow like water morph a protective sphere just as... 368      A tremendous fireball ROARS races down the tunne engulfing Batman in a world of flame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two-Face stands staring into the inferno. Billowing smoke, residual flame and falling debris everywhere. No Batman. A moment of dead quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then Two-Face's smirk vanishes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It can't be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shape rises, phoenix-like, out of the flames. The figure moves forward. 371      BATMAN - CLOSE. As his cape parts over his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lifts his arms, the cape splitting down the center, reverting to it's original form, arms going wide to familiar wings. The Bat heads towards Two-Face and his men. 372      TWO-FACE - CLOSE. Consumed with rage. He grabs a section of the wall's support scaffolding and begins to wrench it free with crazed fury.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why won't you just die?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a final rage of maniacal fury, Harvey wrenches the scaffolding free. It's ancient supports gone...

dialogues.speaker: THE CEILING
dialogues.text: begins to crack and fall, debris pouring in at an ever more furious pace. BATMAN is suddenly doused in a rain of rock and sand.

dialogues.speaker: THE TUNNEL
dialogues.text: between Harvey and Batman is obstructed by tons of falling metal and plaster and sand. TWO-FACE stands as the ceiling falls all around him. 375      BATMAN is driven down by a storm of wreckage. 376      TWO-FACE can barely contain his joy. Plaster and fall ever more furiously. 377      BATMAN stumbles as the ground beneath him sudden sucking him into a quickly filling pit of sand and tile. He reaches for his utility belt but its too late. 378      BATMAN is nearly buried, sand coming up over his his eyes, until finally he is gone. 379      TWO-FACE stands watching, eyes full of childish The floor in front of him begins to give way, running with deep cracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boys, let's go have us a party. (turning) Anybody else feel like donuts?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey and his men head away, up out of the tunnels. 380      THE SAND PIT - CLOSE. Still. No motion. A gloved hand breaks the surface, clutching a Batarang. A weak flip of the wrist. The Batarang hist the sand. The hand goes limp. A beat. Another. Suddenly... A GREEN GLOVED HAND - CLOSE. Grabs Batman's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dick hangs on a wire above Batman in an aerialist's maneuver. He secures his grip and pulls. DICK - CLOSE. Straining. Suddenly, Batman's face breaks the sand. Dick uses the leverage of his body on the rope to pull harder. Batman begins to rise. Free. The two face each other. Hands still clasped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce sits in his robe being bandaged by Alfred. Dick is pacing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell did you think you were doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have a real gratitude problem. You know that, Bruce? I need a name. Batboy? The Dark Earl? What's a good side kick name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about Richard Grayson, college student?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I missed Two-Face by a heartbeat. When we catch him, you gotta let me kill him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't kill. Killing is what damns you. It-. What am I talking about? This conversation is over. You're going away to school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saved your life. You owe me. So either you let me be your partner or I'm going after Harvey on my own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And with that Dick turns and storms out of the Batcave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's starting all over again, Alfred. Another boy lost to rage. And it's my fault. If Harvey hadn't come gunning for me at the circus...His family...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce glances at Gotham Times, of Headline- "Bat More Harm Than Good?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe they're right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which `they' might that be, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack Napier's dead. My parents are avenged. The Wayne Foundation contributes a small fortune to police and crime prevention programs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce touches a cowl resting on the control panel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do I keep doing this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, indeed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could I let Batman go? For Dick. For me. Could I leave the shadows? Have a life. Friends. Family...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Meridian...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce touches his lips, the spot Chase kissed Batman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pained) She's the first woman in a long time that's... No. She's the first woman ever. And she loves Batman. Not Bruce Wayne. If I let go of Batman I'll lose her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps. Perhaps not. Why not ask the lady?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How? As Batman, knowing she wants me? Or as Bruce Wayne and hope...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce reaches to the phone. Hits an autodial key. (OVER) TONES as the phone begins to dial.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?..Hello?..Who is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He disconnects the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who am I Alfred? I don't think I know anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark. Moonlight through curtains. Night SOUNDS. Chase lays asleep in bed. A shadow crosses her face. She stirs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the french doors to her bedroom stands a familiar silhouette. Batman. Chase rises, moves across the room, the pale light catching her white nightgown. She pulls the doors wide. Chase faces him, bodies close. She reaches up, touches his mask. Kisses him. His cape WHIPS around her. THE KISS - CLOSE. Passionate. Sustained. Chase pulls away

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. (sorry) I can't believe it. I've imagined this moment since I first saw you. (touching his glove) Your hands. (touching his mask) Your face. (touching his chest) Your body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns, walks across the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now I have you and.... (shaking her head) Guess a girl has to grow up sometime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She comes back to him, touches his cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've met someone. He's not...you. But... I hope you can understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees now that over her desk, her Batman's memorabilia has been replaced by photos and files on Bruce Wayne. BATMAN - CLOSE. Smiles. Then he's over the balcony and gone, a shadow on the wing in the dead of night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On his throne, in his sphere, electronically getting more brilliant every second, Edward fills all his screens with Chase's image from the party. HIS BRAIN - CLOSE. Rivulets of neural energy ripple and dance as his brain grows under his magenta hair. Suddenly Two-Face gets him by the throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, Ed, we woke up this morning, we just knew we were gonna kill something. The Bat got away. Looks like it's gonna be you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two-Face draws his gun with his free hand. Trains it on Riddler's head. By the look in his eyes, he's serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do we need you? You only come between us. We can be the smartest person in Gotham City. We want the empire for ourselves. Time's up, laughing boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kill me? Well, alright. Go ahead. Take the empire. All yours. (grabbing his own head) Hell, Harv, old pals. I'll kill me for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riddler grabs his hair, starts SLAMMING his own head into the desk-top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too...bad...about...Batman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey grabs his head. Stops him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Batman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riddler smooths his hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if you could know a man's mind? Would you not then own that man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riddler hits a switch. Suddenly his screens fill with the image of Bruce stepping into the simulation at the party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few dozen extra IQ points and my little invention learned a new trick. It does more than drain your brain. It makes a map of your mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The screens change, now showing a turning schematic of a brain, alive with neural lightning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like to see what my old friend Bruce has in his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 384      Riddler hits a switch. Another image pulls free schematic brain. A trapped bat. Fierce. Monstrous. The very picture of imagined evil, made live.  Bruce's nightmare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riddle me this, what kind of man has bats on the brain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two-Face stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead. You can say it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a genius.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tow begin to LAUGH.

dialogues.speaker: BAT
dialogues.text: It's a fake one on top of a pole.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERA PULLS BACK TO REVEAL
dialogues.text: Group of YOUNG KIDS in Halloween costumes running through

dialogues.speaker: GOTHAM CEMETERY
dialogues.text: Two gravestones alone on a hill under a tree. The kids pass Bruce who is visiting his family's graves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy Halloween.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy Halloween.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce lays two roses on Thomas and Martha Wayne's graves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Tonight it ends.

dialogues.speaker: DICK, (OVER)
dialogues.text: What the hell do you mean, it ends?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce and Dick are in mid-conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From this day on, Batman is no more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce hits a switch. The machines in the cave go dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't-.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dick, let go. Revenge will eat you alive. Trust me. I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what about all the good we can do? There are monsters out there. Gotham needs us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And when you finally get Two-Face?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dick looks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly. And once you'd killed him you'd be lost. Like me. (off the cave) All this has to be a choice. Otherwise...it's a curse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce, you can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chase is coming for dinner. Why don't you join us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And with that, Bruce turns, heads up into the house. Dick stands all alone in the still, dark cave. (OVER) A doorbell RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alfred opens the doors to the Trick or Treaters we saw earlier. Hands out bags of candy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A mysterious van sits parked on the gravel byway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two-Face, Riddler, and men sit watching the manor. 391      RIDDLER - POV. A taxi pulls up. Chase emerges as or Treaters leave.

dialogues.speaker: RIDDLER
dialogues.text: And today not even my birthday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two-Face couldn't care less about Chase. He tosses his 393      coin. HOLD ON the spinning faces as (OVER) we he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce, Batman. Bruce, Batman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Opens with a HISS. Dick passes the Batman costumes until he comes to a standing figure different from the rest. His Robin costume.  He packs to leave forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dick rides his motorcycle through the protective hologram of the trees, heading away into the dark night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Intensely romantic. Filled with live roses, Alfred leaves having served an intimate candlelight dinner to Bruce and Chase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's something I want to talk with you about. It's...Well, we.. I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, tiger, take it slow. You going to give me your pin or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce LAUGHS. He's obviously having trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me go first, okay? I think I've found something. About your dreams. I pulled the files on your parents' murders. There was a missing diary, Bruce. Alfred told the police your father always kept it on his desk. But the day after the murders, it was gone. Maybe that's the book you're-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Bruce isn't listening. He's pressing his eyes. Hard. 397      BRUCE - POV. A series of images. The coffins. Th run through the stormy night. The fall. The bat.

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: What is it? What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flashes. Images. Of that night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your memories are repressed. They're trying to break through. Relax. Try to remember-.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to remember!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop fighting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long beat. Then Bruce Wayne surrenders, leans back. Closes his eyes. Remembers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My parents are laid out in the library. Their skin smells like talcum powder. I'm so small. My father's diary is on his desk like always. I'm opening the book. Reading. I'm running out into the storm. The book is in my hands. I can't hear my screams over the rain. I'm falling...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does it say? What hurts so much, Bruce? What does the book say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't-.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do know. Try.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce opens his eyes. Clear. He remembers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The last entry read, Bruce insists on seeing a movie tonight. (a beat) Bruce insists. I made them go out. I made them take me to the movie. To that theater... (finally) It was my fault. I killed them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God, Bruce, you were a child. You weren't responsible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) ...Not the bat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I always thought it was the bat that scared me that night that changed my life. But it wasn't. The real fear was hiding underneath: what I read in the journal, that my parents' deaths were my fault. That's what I couldn't remember. That's the crime I've been paying for all these years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chase. There's something I need to tell you--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (OVER) The doorbell RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: FRONT DOOR
dialogues.text: Alfred peers out to a sea of Halloween Masks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trick or Treat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alfred grabs his candy bags as he opens the door to... 400      The Riddler, Two-Face and the Thugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He CRACKS Alfred on the head with his cane. Down he goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to his thugs) Get the girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thugs appear at both doorways. Bruce moves fast as he grabs a silver serving tray, flips it into one of the screaming Thugs' faces, swings the platter into the other's head. Two down. Bruce grabs Chase's hand and they're out the door, racing fast, several more henchmen in close pursuit.

dialogues.speaker: MEANWHILE
dialogues.text: The Riddler uses the scanner in the head of his cane to locate and open the secret door to the Batcave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce and Chase race towards the stairway. Bruce pulls standing display suits of armor to the floor as he goes, blocking the Thugs' way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riddler has found heaven. From his pouch he produces tiny green bombs shaped like bats. He winds one up, its head SCREECHING with each twist of the neck, lets it fly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that I hear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 405      Like a tiny bat, the first bomb flies into the v wall. A tremendous EXPLOSION.

dialogues.speaker: RIDDLER
dialogues.text: Why it must be the fat lady getting ready to sing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 407      The next bat-bomb flaps into the costume vault. 408      it completely. The crime lab EXPLODES next. 409      The Riddler winds a bunch of bat-bombs now, lets fly. The tiny green bats sail high forming a giant question mark in mid-air before plummeting suddenly in formation down into the cockpit of the Batmobile.

dialogues.speaker: RIDDLER
dialogues.text: (Jack's favorite line) Gonna have a hot time in the old town tonight. (a beat) Who used to say that? Somebody always used to say that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 411      The car EXPLODES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce and Chase flee up the giant staircase, the Thugs a step behind. One two-toned bad-guy leaps forward, gets a fistful of Chase's dress. She goes down. Looks like she's done for. At the last moment, Chase gives a mighty kick and the Thug topples backwards, down the stairs. Bruce is holding off a couple more, closing near the top step. He spins, a powerful roundhouse clocking one in the head, sending him backwards down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chase moves behind him, up to the landing, turns to see Bruce fell another with a spinning back kick, a third with a flying back-fist. Bruce and Chase race to the top of the stairs. 413      TWO-FACE stands on the floor below. Just the mom been waiting for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See ya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He SHOOTS. The bullet grazes Bruce's head. He falls down the grand staircase. CHASE SCREAMS as Thugs grab her. BRUCE hits the floor. Hard. No movement. None at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce, you sure know how to throw a party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two-Face stands over the prostrate form. Draws his gun. S in a new clip of ammo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheath your weapon my impetuous cohort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 414      Riddler has appeared from the Batcave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We want to dust him. We truly want to dust him bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yes, and certainly _WE_ will!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riddler walks over to the unconscious Wayne. Kneels. Looks at him, tender, like a lover. Caresses his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My poor sweet hero.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stands, kicks him hard in the rib cage. Bones CRACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll kill him alright. But first... (calling) Boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With that, the Thugs drag out a freshly bound Chase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riddler drops an envelope (RIDDLE #4) on Bruce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...We're going to make him suffer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sputtering. Burning.

dialogues.speaker: THE COSTUME VAULT
dialogues.text: BATSUIT - CLOSE. Surrounded by licking flames, the Bat emblem begins to melt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as we fall again into a dark hole, the Monarch Bat flying straight at the CAMERA, his red eye filling the SCREEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce is in bed, head bandaged. Alfred is walking a doctor to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The injuries are relatively minor. The shot did cause a concussion. Watch for headaches. Memory lapses. Odd behavior. I'll check back in a few days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alfred ushers him out, returns to Bruce's bedside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you feeling, young man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not that young. It's been a long time since you've called me that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Old habits die hard. Are you alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As well as can be expected, I guess. Give me the bad news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dick has run away. They have taken Dr. Meridian. And I'm afraid they found the cave, sir. It's been destroyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce looks up at Alfred, eyes narrow, puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The case? What cave?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Batsignal lights the sky. Gordon paces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A concerned DEPUTY emerges onto the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mayor's called again. (off the signal) He's not going to show. Maybe he's hurt sir. Maybe he's--.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! (not so sure) ...No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or what's left of it. Melted ruin and rubble. Bruce stands with a worried Alfred, surveying the landscape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disbelieving) I'm Batman? I remember my life as Bruce Wayne. (looking around) But all this. It's like the life of a stranger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps the fall...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's one other thing. I feel..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Afraid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce. Son. Listen to me. You are a kind man. A strong man. But in truth you are not the most sane man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...A bat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I remember a bat. A monster. A demon. Chasing me. (child's terror) Oh my God, Alfred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No demons, son. (touching his head) Your monsters are here. Until you fact that, I fear you will spend your life fleeing them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riddler sits on his throne, absorbing pulses of neural energy, his head growing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's happy time Gotham. Have you hugged your little boxes today? (singing) I'm in heaven. I'm in heaven with a girl like you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chase has been chained to the floor of his throne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Batman will come for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing) Someday my bat will come. Some day my bat will come. (suddenly lethal) I'm counting on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts his face close to Chase's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're frying your brain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nap time gorgeous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Riddler draws a hypo filled with green liquid. He plunges it into her neck as she passes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce stands before a dark, rocky mouth. Through this passage, the cave as it once was, sweating granite, a shifting world of shadow. Bruce steps inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FAVOR BRUCE as he walks deeper into the darkness. The walls around him undulate, as if covered in water. 427      WALLS - CLOSER. The movement isn't water at all. restless shrugging of bats. Thousands of bats. 428      Bruce presses on. Sweat beads on his face. Ahead, a diffusion of moonlight illuminates a curving rock chamber, bats here too bringing the walls to life. Bruce moves into the moonlight. Looks up. 429      BRUCE - POV. A narrow chute. The fall he took as He kneels, there on the floor, worn by years of weather, a single book. A diary. Bruce kneels, touches the leather cover, fingers lingering for a moment on his father's embossment, before he turns yellowed pages to the last entry. Painfully, by moonlight, he reads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dreaded confirmation) Bruce insists on seeing a movie tonight...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pauses, gathers himself. He continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Martha and I have our hearts set on Zorro, so Bruce's cartoon will have to wait until next week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce stares at the book in disbelief. Then he looks up at the moonlight, tears streaming down his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Not my fault. It wasn't my fault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 430      Suddenly, in the darkness ahead, a dark shape mo rising, slits opening to reveal two blood red eyes. The giant monarch bat spreads its wings, huge, as it rises, suddenly airborne, rushing toward him. 431      BRUCE - CLOSE. And terrified. He turns to run. T flapping wings BEAT like drums, closing fast. Bruce holds his ground. Resolved. He turns and faces the monster, SCREECHING towards him, glistening fangs barely inches from his face. Something remarkable happens. The bat holds its position, stares into Bruce's eyes, wings spreading wide. A beat. Then Bruce raises his arms, a living mirror. The two stand facing each other, man and bat. In the moon- light on the wall, their shadows begin to blend, to merge, becoming one _SHIMMERING WHITE LIGHT!_

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mouth of the inner cave. A sudden SCREAMING DIN as a storm of bats explode into the cave, a shooting column of life and there, from within, steps a man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALFRED stands at the entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Master, Bruce?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Batman, Alfred. I'm Batman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Batsignal shines. Suddenly the air above the familiar circle begins to shimmer and glow, becoming... A giant green question mark. The Batsignal itself is now just the small period at the symbol's bottom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce stands at the ruined control platform. Riddles are spread before him. Including the most recent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the answers are numbers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But 1, 3, 1, 8, & 5. What do they mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do maniacs always want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Recognition, of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precisely. So this number is probably some kind of calling card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce stares at the numbers. Adds them: 18. Squares them: 1916425. No luck. Starts again, separating them: 13/18/5.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letters in the alphabet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. 13 is M....MRE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about, MR. E.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mystery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And another name for Mystery?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enigma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly. Mr. E. Mister Edward Nygma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce leads Alfred through a secret stairway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good thing Mr. E. didn't know about the cave under the cave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark, jagged, surrounded by water. Here, the Batwing and Batboat are stored.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What now sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claw Island. Nygma's headquarters. I'm sure that's where they're keeping Chase. (realizing) Are all the Batsuits destroyed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All except the prototype with the sonar modifications you so disapprove of. But it hasn't yet been tested.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tonight's a good night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 438      CLOSE ON - Batman's fist being shoved into a new 439      CLOSE ON - Batman's new boot snapping shut. 440      CLOSE ON - the improved Utility Belt buckling on 441      CLOSE ON - the new cowl sliding down over Batman

dialogues.speaker: PULL BACK TO REVEAL
dialogues.text: The Batman - a darker enemy to fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you suggest, Alfred. By see or by air?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not both?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A figure steps out of the shadows. Dick. The cape is now black, yellow on the inside only. A red armored vest compliments green tights with knee armor, a utility belt and flexible black boots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dick... Where did you get that suit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I...um..took the liberty, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you could use a friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce stares at him a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He extends his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A partner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Dynamic Duo clasp hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fast clouds. Bowing trees. Suddenly, the entire tennis court slides away. The Batwing rises into the night sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Batboat hits the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commissioner Gordon and his deputy, standing vigil under the false moon of the Batsignal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finally) He's not coming. Shut it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Deputy reaches for the power switch. Suddenly, a ROAR cuts the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Batsignal. The ROAR grows louder. Light and shadow dance, for a second it seems the Batsignal itself is flying toward us. Suddenly -- The Batwing bursts _through_ the signal. 447      The dark plane BUZZES Police Headquarters, dippi to Gordon. 448      A triumphant Gordon waves Batman onward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Working the controls, Batman is back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still, night waters. Suddenly, the Batboat, running silent and dark, cuts across the harbor. 451      Dick is at the helm, wearing night-vision goggle 452      DICK'S POV -- INFRA-RED. Claw Island looms ahead

dialogues.speaker: SEARCHLIGHTS
dialogues.text: atop the island headquarters pop on, one by one, flooding the water with light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Riddler and Two-Face stand clutching controls on opposite sides of a holographically generated game of Battleship. Each is firing tiny blips at the small dot crossing the floating screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A mortar EXPLODES aft of the Batboat, shooting a WATER SPOUT high in the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A miss. And my favorite vitamin, I might add.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another EXPLOSION to stern. Dick is thrown as a third shell hits the Batboat. The craft EXPLODES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sunk my battleship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dick slips a re-breather into his mouth. Dives underwater, starts to swim towards Claw Island.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SPEAR shoots past leaving a trail of bubbles. Another.

dialogues.speaker: A HIDDEN BUNKER
dialogues.text: issues a stream of armed frogmen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BATWING soars over the water.

dialogues.speaker: INFRA-RED SCREEN
