dialogues.text: A Dick blip, besieged underwater by frogmen blips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A laser shoots from the top of the stronghold, neatly 465      severing one of the Batwing's wings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Batwing dives straight into the river.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BATMAN - POV - THROUGH THE WINDSCREEN. The water comes up fast, a rushing EXPLOSION.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark panels shift, sealing wheel hubs, growing sleek fins as the Batwing morphs now into the Batsub.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two frogmen hold Dick by arms and legs as several more swim towards him with exposed knives.

dialogues.speaker: THE BATSUB
dialogues.text: BLASTS over an underwater reef. 471      A TORPEDO TUBE - CLOSE. FIRES a dark rocket towa frogmen at blinding speed. 472      A FROGMAN - CLOSE. Spins. 473      FROGMAN'S POV - THROUGH MASK. The torpedo racing him unfurls to reveal...Batman. 474      BATMAN'S FIST smashes the glass of the Frogman's 475      THE THUG rises in a mass of bubbles. 476      DICK uses the distraction and kicks free. Batman take on the frogmen, hand to hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Batman and Dick break the surface. Dick discards his re- breather. Climbs onto the shore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy rusted metal, Batman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dick takes a few steps forward, kneels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off the rusted floor) The ground. It's metal and its full of holes. You know. Holey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This place was a refueling station for subs during the war...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just as Batman starts to climb out of the water (OVER) a horrendous CRUNCHING as Dick begins to rise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The island surface is actually the top of a tremendous metal sphere balanced atop an enormous cylindrical oil tank, rising, now, fast out of the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 479      Batman throws a Batarang but it glances off the the sphere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Batman stands staring up at Dick, who stands alone atop the metal sphere now near five stories high. No way up. Batman spots a rusting access panel in the giant support cylinder. He RIPS it off and climbs inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dick stands looking down at the ocean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bat or the Bird. We couldn't decide who got to kill who. (a beat) Or is it whom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dick spins. Two-Face has emerged from a hatch atop the dome. He stands smiling at Dick, a knife in his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We flipped for it. We got you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two-Face's leap is savage, catching Dick by the throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two slide down the sloping edge of the dome, their descent stopped by a narrow, rusting metal lip. Two-Face SMASHES Dick's head into the side of the dome. Once. Twice. Three times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong, circus-boy? No mommy and daddy to save you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two-Face raises his blade over the dazed Dick. Brings it down fast. Dick rolls clear, the blade wedging into the rusted metal surface. All the time Dick needs. He back-flips erect, kicks Two-Face hard in the head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For my mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A flying front kick to the chin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For my father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A spinning back kick knocking him to his knees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For Chris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dick hauls off and smashes him in the face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The punch sends Two-Face rolling down the side of the dome, fingers raking sloping steel, finding no purchase. 483      At the last second, Two-Face grabs a small metal on the belly of the dome's curve, hanging on for dear life, feet kicking wildly over the abyss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The scales are tipped. The blindfold torn from the lady's eyes. Justice will be served.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rusting metal bulge starts to tear and break.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a man after my own heart, son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The metal breaks free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grinning) See you in hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two-Face's hands tear through the rust. He falls. 484      DICK'S HAND grabs him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dick hoists him to safety.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I'd rather see you in jail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bat's taught you well. Noble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two-Face spins, a gun suddenly in his hand, pressing now into the flesh between Dick's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A mistake. But definitely noble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two-Face COCKS the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Immense. Empty. Just the CRASHING surf and rocks below. Batman looks up. The ceiling is... 486      A GIANT STEEL GRATE flush with the sides of the Batman loads a Batarang into his launcher. FIRES. 487      THE BATARANG flies high, secures purchase on the 488      BATMAN attaches the cable to the winch on his be Begins rising fast.

dialogues.speaker: THE GRATE BOLTS
dialogues.text: EXPLODE, causing the giant grate to fall towards Batman. 490      BATMAN twirls on the rope so he is rising upside his feet racing towards the plummeting grate. He hits a switch on his utility belt-

dialogues.speaker: THRUSTERS
dialogues.text: on his new Batsuit ROCKET him feet first towards the descending grate. 492      IMPACT! The grate flips like a pie pan. Batman l the wire, cutting his thrusters and tumbling in mid-air so his hands now extend before him. He grabs one of the steel girders in the darkness overhead. 493      Batman hangs, watching the now dislodged grate f the watery depth below. A beat. He hoists himself onto a steel platform to face...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Riddler sits across the room in his throne, a huge antenna shooting up into the night sky behind him through a round hole in the dome. A large ring of Green Neon encircles him, feeding him more and more brain power.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to my parlor said the Riddler to the Bat. How's tricks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No more tricks, Edward. Release Chase and Dick. This is between you and me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two-Face steps from behind The Riddler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And me and me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off the antenna) ...Of course. The Box does more than enhance neural energy. You've been sucking Gotham's brainwaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now it's new. Improved. Better than ever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 495      SCREENS - CLOSE - Endless schematics of flickeri

dialogues.speaker: BATMAN
dialogues.text: ...The jolt I felt in the beam at your party. (getting it) You've devised a way to map the human brain. To read men's minds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Bruce, you are clever. How fitting that numbers lead you to me. For numbers will crown me king. My Box will sit on countless TV's around the globe, mapping brains, giving me credit card numbers. Bank codes. Safe combinations. Numbers of infidelities. Of crimes. Of lies told. No secret is safe from my watchful electronic eye. I will rule the planet. For if knowledge is power then tremble world, Edward Nygma has become a God. (to Harvey) Was that over the top?  I can never tell... (to Batman) By the way, B-man, I got _your_ number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 497      SCREENS - CLOSE form a towering picture of Batma 498      OTHER SCREENS - CLOSE form a towering picture of 499      The images collide, forming a half Bruce, half B

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've seen your mind. Yours is the greatest Riddle of all. Can Bruce Wayne and Batman ever truly coexist? Stop me if I'm wrong here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Batman remains stoic, but The Riddler is right on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So let's help you decide, once and for all, who you really are. Behind Curtain #1...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A curtain rises: Chase in a cylinder, bound unconscious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The captivating Dr. Chase Meridian. Love of Bruce Wayne's life. Behind curtain #2...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another curtain reveals: Dick in similar peril.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Batman's one and only partner. (a beat) Below, my personal favorite...

dialogues.speaker: TRAP DOORS
dialogues.text: beneath Chase and Dick open wide. ANGLE DOWN to the jagged rocks and crashing surf below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A watery grave!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 501      A BUTTON - CLOSE. Shaped like a glowing green sk

dialogues.speaker: RIDDLER
dialogues.text: A simple touch and five seconds later these two day players are so much gull feed on the rocks below. Not enough time to save them both. So who will it be? Bruce's love? Batman's partner? You decide. Is this fun or what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward, you've become a monster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You flatter me. No monster. Just The Riddler, and here's yours. What is without taste or sound, all around, but can't be found? On your mark, get set...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Riddler reaches for the button. Batman steps forward. 503      ANGLE from the water below. The floor between where Batman stands and the Riddler's throne platform is translucent. A hologram masking a tremendous gap. Batman is about to step into an abyss. 504      Batman stops short. Looks up at Riddler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Death. (louder) Death. Without taste, sound and all around us. (getting it) Because there is no way for me to save them or myself. This is one giant death trap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excellent. See. Who says a guy in a rubber suit can't be smart? Well, it's been grand. Sorry you all have to die now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riddler touches the skull button. (OVER) A SCREECH. Batman looks up. 505      HIGH ABOVE the Riddler's antenna a giant monarch glides across the night. 506      THE BAT - CLOSE. 507      BATMAN - CLOSE. No fear. A moment of communion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. I have a riddle for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For _me_? Really? Tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see without seeing. To me, darkness is as clear as daylight. What am I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh please. You're blind as a bat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Batman SLAMS his Utility Belt, releasing a high energy Batarang which he hurls at the Riddler's huge antenna.

dialogues.speaker: THE BATARANG
dialogues.text: SMASHES into the Riddler's antenna. A tremendous EXPLOSION of sparks as the transceiver short circuits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room goes pitch black. 509      RIDDLER'S FINGER - CLOSE. Hits the skull button.

dialogues.speaker: DICK AND CHASE
dialogues.text: drop, plummet through space. 511      BATMAN - CLOSE. Two metal lids SHUT over Batman'

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE MASK
dialogues.text: Small sonar screens on the back of Batman's eyepieces reveal the phantom floor and the wild criss-cross of interconnected steel beams and the crashing ocean below.

dialogues.speaker: BATMAN
dialogues.text: throws another Batarang, which lassos a beam overhead, swings forward, grabbing a falling Chase as he passes, depositing her on a steel platform. 514      BATMAN - POV (SONAR SCREENS). Dick drops to cert

dialogues.speaker: BATMAN
dialogues.text: dives towards the sea below as he whips another Batarang 516      around a passing girder. He catches Dick just ab rocks precisely as the Batrope pulls taught, using the bat-winch to shoot them back up to the platform.

dialogues.speaker: BATMAN
dialogues.text: As he rests Dick on the platform beside Chase. Suddenly his world flares a blinding white.

dialogues.speaker: TWO-FACE
dialogues.text: stands on the platform before him, a halogen light strapped around his head, blinding Batman's sensors. Two-Face brandishes his gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All those heroics for nothing. No more riddles, no more curtains one and two. Just plain old curtains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He COCKS the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haven't you forgotten something, Harvey? You're always of two minds about everything....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The handsome side of Harvey's face turns toward them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Emotion is so often the enemy of justice. Thank you, Bruce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes out his famous coin and flips it. Batman starts to reach for his Utility Belt, to out-smart Two-Face. But as the coin flies high up in the air, it comes down just a hair too far away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 519      As Two-Face reaches out to catch it, he loses hi and falls to the rocks and angry sea below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help Chase. I'll be back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (groggy) Did Two-Face call him Bruce?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 520      Batman starts scaling girders, pulls himself bac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights are still down but the antenna's functioning again, the Riddler in his throne, absorbing pulses of neural energy. Too much. his entire head seems to distort, fluctuating in size and wavering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why can't I kill you? Now there's a riddle? (more juice) Not smart enough. Find a way. (more juice) Too many questions. (more juice) Why you and not me? (more juice) Why me? (more juice) Why                        !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Batman SLAMS the power switch, the throne going dark. EDWARD - CLOSE. Knees drawn to his chest. Pathetic. WHIMPERING. Mad. Batman looks down, his eyes sad, compassionate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poor, Edward. I had to save them both. You see, I am Bruce Wayne and Batman. Not because I have to be. Now because I choose to be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Batman reaches out to Edward. Ed jerks in fear, looks up. 522      EDWARD'S POV - Coming towards him, not Batman, b hideous demonic giant bat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another stormy night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Burton walks the corridor with Chase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward Nygma has been screaming for hours that he knows the true identity of Batman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They reach Edward's cell.

dialogues.speaker: INT. PADDED CELL
dialogues.text: Lit only by the moon. Chase speaks through the small barred set into the heavy door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Dr. Meridian. Chase. Do you remember me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could I forget?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Burton tells me you know who Batman is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (giggle, giggle) Yesssssss. I know!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chase and Burton look at each other, on edge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is The Batman, Edward?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't tell if you don't say please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right, Edward. I didn't mean to be impolite. Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No response. Just GIGGLES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward, please. Who is Batman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat. Suddenly a huge silhouette of a bat appears on the padded wall. Into it leaps Edward, the sleeves of his straightjacket madly flapping like the wings of a bat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I AM BATMAAAAAAANN!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chase comes down the front steps to find Alfred waiting with the Rolls, holding the rear door open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alfred?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Wayne sent me to pick you up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alfred drives out the front gates of Arkham Asylum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Bruce?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He asked me to convey his deepest apologies, Dr. Meridian. But he wanted me to give you this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alfred hands her a small wicker figure. The dream doll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said to thank you. And to tell you he no longer needs it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She notices the Batsignal in the night sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does it ever end Alfred?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Miss. Not in this lifetime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chase looks out the car window. In the distance, the shape of the bat shimmers against the clouds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Batsignal, filling the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Batman stands on the edge of the gargoyled building, a lone silhouette keeping vigil over the city. Then another figure steps up into frame, taking his place behind Batman. Their capes billow in the city wind. Now there are two guardians of the night: Batman and Robin. Beware! FINAL FADE TO BLACK.
